RESPONSIBILITIESJob description

N3 Luxury Living is searching for a Senior Construction Analyst for our growing luxury living multi-family. property development company

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Analyzes, tracks, monitors, and prepares reporting on project budgets and actual expenses and costs.
-Provides reporting on variances and risk exposure, develops and presents solutions and action plans.

- Manages lien notices.
- Conducts studies that involve compiling data, analyzing results, preparing and maintaining documentation, and proposing/implementing recommendations.

WE SEEK:
- Strong organizationaland time management skills.

- Works well in a fast-paced environment
- Self-started who works well with a team and is highly self-motivated and goal oriented.
- Proven ability to work independently.
- Manages multiple project. - Adapts and exhibits flexibility with changing priorities. - Solution-oriented, identifies and recommends resolutions using analytical skills. - Exhibits sound judgment. - Proficient in Microsoft Office. - Proficient in Construction processes. - Prior experience with Sage 300 (Timberline), preferred.
- Minimum five (5)+ years of contruction or related experience, required.
- Bachelors degree in Accounting or Finance, required.

Help, Hope, Solutions: BCBA

Job Type: Full-time
Location: Plano, Texas
Salary: $70,000 - $75,000/year

Organization Overview:
Help, Hope, Solutions provides ABA therapy for children and adolescents on the autism spectrum. We use a unique approach and all individualized programming and goals to ensure the most effective treatment outcomes for our clients. The company embraces a supportive and collaborative environment, and we host staff events to encourage team bonding and promote a motivating and positive work environment!

Position Summary:
The BCBA will have the responsibility of maintaining a caseload of clients and RBT’s to oversee. BCBA’s will be under the direct supervision of the Clinical and Executive VPs and will serve as the point of contact for all RBT’s, Team leads, parents and clients on their caseload.

Responsibilities and Duties:

o Complete Assessments, Reassessments, and treatment plans

o Design individual intervention plans based on assessment outcomes

o Design effective behavior intervention plans to decrease maladaptive behaviors.

o Analyze data, trends, graphs as directly related to client progress

o Monitor treatment progress

o Provide Parent training/collaboration

o Collaborate with ST, OT and PT

o Supervise own caseload of clients and RBT’s

o Train and checklist staff weekly

o Fulfill average weekly billable requirements

o Fulfills documentation in observations, checklists, supervision forms, and maintenance of clients’ folders

Qualifications and Experience:

BCBA is required to:

o Be a BCBA in good standing with the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB)

o Professional communication skills with both the staff and the parents or guardians

o Current state licensure from the Texas Department of Licensure and Regulations (or ability to be licensed through their agency).

o Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.

o Independently and efficiently manage, and organize responsibilities related to maintaining client caseload.

o Implement critical thinking and clinical evaluation in designing, testing, and implementing behavior procedures.

o Child development experience preferred

Company Benefits:

o BCBA & Privately Owned Company!

o Eligible for Health Insurance after 90 days of employment

o Eligible for Dental & Vision Insurance after 60 days of employment

o Retirement Plan | 401k Matching (Fidelity)

o Generous PTO & Paid Holidays

o Above Market Salaries for Qualified and Experienced BCBA’s

o Performance Based Bonuses

o Company Paid Licensure Renewal & 8-Hour Supervision Training

o Paid CEUs

o Professional Liability Insurance Provided

o Credentialing with Insurance Companies

o Coaching and Mentorship with Exceptionally Seasoned BCBA’s

o Paid Parental Leave

o Work From Home Flexibility Dependent on Competency Level

Pre-Employment Screening:

o We are a child-focused and insurance credentialed company; therefore, employment is dependent on the results of a criminal background check (Federal, State, and County), the results of a pre-employment drug screening, and the verification of two employment references.

Classification:

o Employee, Salaried – Exempt

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to pick up, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk and hear. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Equal Opportunity Employment: It is the policy of Help, Hope, Solutions to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment and not to discriminate on any basis prohibited by law, including race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit-based factors. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring practices, appraisal systems, promotions, and training and career development programs.

BGC Records Analyst I - Job Description

Reports to: BGC Director of Operations

Job purposeThe BGC Records Analyst I is an entry-level position that serves as a research specialist for select databases used to conduct Background Check searches. This role requires integrity and dependability when handling confidential, sensitive information: an ethical disposition is mandatory. This role must display a high attention to detail and must be willing to adapt to ongoing regulation and/or departmental changes or updates.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Performs Background Check searches and data retrieval via select databases, including but not limited to, county, state and federal systems
Sorts and reviews Background Check records to determine standards for reportability
Analyzes data appropriately while following strict compliance procedures and adhering to quality standards
Ability to learn, process and retain complex information related to background research and screening
Prepares accurate and grammatically correct reports; summarizes the data collected from research
Handles personal identifying information responsibly and keeps confidential information private
Maintains daily performance levels that meet or exceed the established standards for the department
Protects applicant and customer information in accordance with internal policy and procedures
Other duties as assigned

Position Type / Expected Hours of Work
This is a full time (35-40 hours per week) IN OFFICE position. Office hours are Monday through Thursday 8:00-5:00, and Friday 8:00-3:00.

Work Experience Requirements

Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong interpersonal skills to build relationships
Experience researching public information accessible via the internet is preferred
Ability to work independently while in support of the department team as a whole
Experience working with sensitive and confidential data
Ability to handle and keep in confidence all Confidential Information
Strong Computer Literacy
G-Suite proficiency is preferred
Ability to navigate quickly between multiple windows
Positive attitude with a self-driven sense of urgency

Summary

The Payroll & Business Analystwill lead the payroll process for Mowi USA business unit. Will be responsible for processing payroll, providing technical aid and supporting process improvement for Human Resources. The Payroll & Business Analyst will establish the developing of automated payroll processes: increasing payroll functionality, preparing monthly reports and managing payroll functions. Will also be in charge of preparing monthly payroll accrual, assisting with general accounting tasks and the monthly close process. The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Responsibilities

Ensure payroll is processed timely and accurately.
Enter weekly payroll changes (not processed through self-service and HR processes). Audit the payroll register to ensure changes were captured and payroll is accurate.
Develop strong relationships with HR, through partnering with the team and assisting in process improvement related to HR functions and payroll systems. Provide excellent customer service to Mowi employees.
Support HR in the development of resources within Workforce Now, including: recruitment, employee goals and appraisals, reporting and analytical resources.
Provide support in the development of electronic employee files, including: assistance with self-audits and recommendations for improvements.
Support continued development of Workforce Now to provide improved self-service experience and increase self-service use.
Lead annual benefit and compliance reporting and audit processes, including: 401k audit, workers compensation audit, Self-Insured Medical Plan audit, 1095 review, EEO1 filing, etc.
Process weekly 401k contribution upload and reconcile payroll and 401k data.
Manage all garnishments, deductions, and Paid Time Off (PTO) balances in ADP Workforce Now.
Manage ACA compliance within Workforce Now.
Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in payroll.
Assist with the maintenance of fixed assets including processing additions, dispositions and running monthly depreciation.
Reconcile bank accounts including checking, payroll and lockbox accounts.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
·Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Experience using ADP Workforce Now preferred.
Must possess thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in a corporate environment preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in Payroll preferred.

**All requirements and skills are considered to be essential, unless otherwise indicated.**

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multigenerational family, or active adult.

The Division Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing reports and models, reviewing financials, and data mining to formulate and deliver fact-based pricing strategies to division leadership. This position will work closely with various department to understand factors impacting the pricing and selling process to develop and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Division Business Analyst must possess the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of a problem, which requires the willingness to question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
Manage overall pricing process including providing recommendations and obtaining approvals on home-by-home pricing and release order and communicating results across the sales organization.
Recommend price adjustments to Management based on an analysis of historical sales trends, current and future market conditions and the overall market supply and demand dynamic.
Collaborate with Division lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that influence top line Revenue growth.
Provide revenue management functional expertise and leadership to management team and market sales leaders.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business and issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly translate data, insights, and forecasts into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise recommendations to senior division leadership.
Track, create, maintain, and analyze data.
Develop new skills, techniques, and statistical models for predicting future operational results, costs and key performance metrics.
Consolidate, prepare, and analyze operational data to understand cause and effect relationships and identify and share root causes.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.

#CB #LI-VR1

Qualifications:
Education and Experience Requirement:
Bachelor’s Degree in related field (business, finance, etc) preferred.
MBA would be helpful.
2 years as a Revenue and/or Pricing Manager, Business analyst or comparable experience preferred.
Experience in the homebuilding industry would be helpful.
Experience with business software preferred (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence)
Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the ability to work in excess of eight hours per day in the confined quarters of an office. Also requires the ability bend, stoop, reach, lift, move and/or carry items less than 25 pounds. Finger dexterity in operating a computer keyboard and calculator. Requires sitting at a computer monitor for extended periods of time, completing paperwork and to receive/return phone messages.


Additional Requirements:
Demonstrates skills and experience developing and performing quantitative analysis which may include financial and/or statistical modeling.
Experience presenting to and communicating with Executives.
Strong oral, written, listening and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate in business terms using simple, concise and relatable examples.
Strong quantitative and analytical foundation with the ability to translate data into actionable and relevant insights and answers to questions.
Engages and establish cooperative working relationships with Associates at various lines of business.
Ability to adapt thinking based on new points of view and/or changes in operating environments.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, delegate work and provide leadership across functions.
Prioritize and plan work activities, use time efficiently, set goals and objectives and develop realistic action plans.
Think critically to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, develop alternative solutions and work well in group problem solving situations.
Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness, look for ways to improve and promote quality, apply feedback to improve performance and monitor own work to ensure quality.
This position outlines the basic tasks and requirements for the position noted. It is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties of the Associates. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Wheeler Staffing Partners is hiring a Financial Data Analyst with an automotive client’s corporate office in Irving, TX. The Data Analyst will join the Data and Analytics group and play a key role in promoting data-driven decision-making while providing valuable insights into business performance and trends through the evaluation of extensive datasets. This role primarily involves creating dashboards and data visualizations, conducting ad-hoc data analysis, and preparing essential materials for Senior Management, as well as field and corporate support teams. This is an on-site role, reporting to the Irving office Mon-Fri.

Financial Data Analyst Job Responsibilities:

Supports database architecture by identifying sources of information, assembling, verifying and backing-up data.
Builds and maintains data pipelines, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Provides quality assurance of incoming data and associated deliverables.
Assists in the preparation of financial and operational reports by collecting, formatting, and analyzing information to help identify business and process improvement opportunities.
Supports Data and Analytics leadership’s work collaborating across the organization to define key performance indicators (KPI’s) and build dashboards that support ongoing reporting and analysis of business results.
Conducts ad-hoc analysis to assist in decision making for executive management.
Works in a team-based setting to provide financial and operational value-add reports for utilization by executive and field management.
Runs queries, identifies relevant insights, and compiles reporting and analytics output for presentation to upper management.
Collects, organizes, analyzes, and disseminates significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy through the use of SQL/SSRS reporting.
Works cross-functionally to identify, report, and fix data quality issues using sustainable and best practice tools and processes.
Other responsibilities may include improving current methods used in the collection of data from other parts of the company while retaining the essential integrity and security of the information collected.

Financial Data Analyst Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Economics, Finance, Accounting, or Computer Science with a focus in quantitative methodologies.
3-4 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst (Finance and Accounting experience a plus).
Must be willing to work onsite
Advanced proficiency in PowerBI, including building and maintaining dashboards.
Advanced proficiency in SQL.
Experience with R and/or Python.
Experience writing and managing stored procedures, views, and functions, that rely heavily on analytics functions.
Advanced proficiency with MS Excel (Macros, VBA, V-Lookup, Pivot Tables, etc.).
Proficiency with accounting platforms.
Knowledge of GAAP.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple assignments in a fast paced, deadline driven work environment.
Strong math and statistical skills
Team mentality, perseverance, time management and strong prioritization skills

As a member of the Data and Analytics team, the Sr. Data Analyst role will contribute to the success in both the daily operations and long-term strategy of the organization’s data assets. The optimal candidate brings a business-centric mindset to data analysis efforts and has a track record of being a growth enabler.

· Excellent prioritization skills

The Business Analyst will bring to the table a strong analytical mindset, communication finesse, and a demonstrated ability of translating a wide range of data inputs into actionable information. This role presents a unique opportunity to collaborate directly with the President and shape the fabric of strategic decision‐making.
1. Collaborate closely with the President to support critical day‐to‐day analytical and tactical follow through needs.
2. Conduct market research, assess data, and develop insights into market trends and pricing strategies.
3. Provides analysis of revenue, market share, and competitor activity to develop optimal market strategies.
4. Conduct elasticity of demand analysis to optimize pricing decisions.
5. Identify opportunities to maximize profitability while maintaining competitiveness.
6. Apply advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights, spot trends, and empower data‐driven decision‐making. Expertly employ sophisticated tools to manipulate and effectively present data.
7. Collaborate with cross‐functional teams to facilitate project planning, monitoring, and tracking, ensuring punctual and precision‐driven project delivery.
8. Assist with the creation of reports and presentations as needed by the President & COO.
9. Maintain a database of historical pricing data to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of pricing and guide pricing decisions.
10. Develop an intuitive understanding of the marketplace via hands‐on field work with both end users and distributors.
11. Perform all other duties as assigned.
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, or STEM related field. One (1) to three (3) years in a Business Analyst role or equivalent. Strong analytical skills for translating a variety of data inputs into actionable insights. Proficiency in data analysis, data visualization, and tools such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI. High proficiency with Excel is a must. Effective written and verbal communication skills for clear, concise documentation. Detail‐oriented mindset committed to delivering high‐quality work. Self‐starter mentality. Problem‐solving aptitude for identifying issues and proposing solutions. Econometrics and/or quantitative market research familiarity a plus.

Job Title: Lead SAP Architect - OTC, SCM-GATP, IBP
Job Description:
McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve – we care. What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow’s health today, we want to hear from you.

Job title: Lead SAP Architect - OTC, SCM-GATP, IBP

Current Need

We are recruiting for a Lead Architect with SAP OTC background to support the combined US Pharmaceutical Solutions & Services business areas specific to Order to Cash solutions and other integrated business process areas. Will need to work collaboratively with the Principal Architects, OTC Solution Development & Support teams, other SAP teams, in addition to solution teams in McKesson Technology areas including Customer Experience/B2B, Global Finance/MDM, Distribution Operations, Procure to Pay & Data & Analytics. This role is responsible for bringing in overall Order to Cash solution expertise and providing leadership & direction to the teams around the end-to-end business processes within the ecosystem.

This is an exciting, hands-on role based out of our Las Colinas office (Dallas, TX). As a McKesson Technology (MT) knowledge leader for the OTC business processes and MT’s diverse operational systems, you are to provide technical thought leadership in support of McKesson’s business objectives.

Advise the business and help define optimal solutions for the combined US Pharmaceutical Solutions & Services business areas specific to Order to Cash solutions and integrated business process areas such as Customer Ordering Portal.
Responsible to lead key design activities, milestones, and lead consensus discussions/alignment with key OTC business stakeholders, middleware teams such as Mulesoft, EDI & Customer Ordering Portal teams.
Collaborate well with multiple teams across business units and MT teams to define, design and execute solutions that meet business and technical service requirements

Company Summary:

Vytalogy is a modern wellness company, - we bring a vibrant energy to life. Headquartered in Sherman Oaks, CA, Vytalogy markets products across multiple channels and categories in vitamins, minerals, and supplements (VMS). Our incredible brands, Natrol and Jarrow Formulas, are recognized and trusted as industry leaders for over 85 years. We bring together exceptional talent and harness diverse backgrounds and perspectives to make life more vibrant for everyone, every day.

Position Summary:

The Finance Analyst will assist in analyzing operational costs for the company, budgeting/forecasting, costing products, and acting as the finance business partner for our newly built Texas facility. The primary duty of a role is to gather financial data (e.g., manufacturing consumption, labor costs, etc) and analyze the data in accordance with company directives. This position must have strong communication, interpersonal, analytical, and technological skills. The Finance Operations Analyst will report to the Director Finance - Supply Chain and work closely with the Manufacturing Production team.

Your primary activities will include but are not limited to:

Responsible for maintaining item costs to assure accuracy of ingredient costs and labor and overhead content.
Analyze/Audit actual manufacturing costs and prepare periodic reports comparing standard costs to actual production costs.
Responsible for monitoring production yield and comparison to standard yield.
Monitor and report on the performance of labor and overhead standards as compared to actual costs.
Participate in establishing manufacturing performance standards while leveraging the ERP system.
Monitoring unit cost and production cost variances.
Generate Ad hoc financial analysis as required by management for all aspects of the business.
Collect data to determine the cost of and differences between the various manufacturing processes to provide support on variances.
Develop and distribute weekly/monthly KPI reports for Supply Chain.
Participate in other duties/projects as assigned by management.
In addition to the aforementioned responsibilities, the successful candidate will work closely with our operations team in Texas to ensure efficient and cost effective start up of our newly built gummy production facility and distribution center.

You’ll need the following (minimum qualifications):

Bachelor’s degree in business management, finance, operations, logistics, or a similar field.
ERP Application knowledge in the manufacturing space, SAP preferred.
Proven experience as a cost analyst, cost specialist or similar role.
Computer skills – MO Office Products, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Ability to analyze data and make recommendations for process improvement.

A reasonable estimate of the current base salary range for this position is $70,000 to $90,000. Actual compensation offered may vary depending on skill level, experience, and/or education. Global Risk and Security (GR&S) at Vanguard enables business strategy, protects client and Vanguard interests (e.g., assets and data), and stewards a strong risk culture. Our teams leverage enterprise-wide insights, deep expertise, and trusted advice so that across Vanguard leaders and crew drive faster, stronger, risk-informed decisions.

Within GR&S, the Enterprise Security and Fraud (ES&F) sub-division is responsible for the global protection of Vanguard crew, property, data, and client assets. We are the trusted advisors that protect the pride of Vanguard with state-of-the-art security and fraud capabilities. We are a world-class destination of highly-engaged, passionate, and diverse talent expected to continuously learn and develop in an ever-changing security landscape.

In this role, you will:

Lead the policy creation for various facets of DLP at Vanguard.
Lead, develop, manage, maintain and enhance security controls (alerts, rules, policies, and signatures) for the security platforms.
Conduct threat modeling exercises by leveraging threat intelligence frameworks. Orchestrate threat hunts in coordination with department and divisional partners to determine gaps in existing security controls.
Ensure proper defense depth design, configurations, and best practice for preventive solutions pertaining to the network environment for new and evolving cyber threats. Identify malicious activity by performing analysis on logs, traffic flows, and other investigative detective activities.
Provide support on tool and vendor assessments for Vanguard's DLP needs.
Provide written assessments focused on threats, vulnerabilities, and technologies relevant to Vanguard Infrastructure.
Lead with IT and business teams to ensure prompt and effective distribution of findings so incidents are addressed in the most effective and efficient manner possible. Provide department support to the business on enterprise-wide security initiatives and projects.
Mentor junior team members to improve their technical acumen.


What it takes:

Minimum of eight years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required. Graduate degree preferred.
Experience in DLP (Cloud, Email, Network, and End Point) preferred.
Expertise is configuring policy in DLP platforms and regular expressions preferred.
Preferred CISSP within one year of hire.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing customer data, generating actionable insights, and contributing to improving customer experiences. Engage directly with customers, gather feedback, and use data to drive informed business decisions aimed at enhancing customer satisfaction and organizational success.

Responsibilities and Duties

Customer Data Analysis:


o Reconcile customer data against our data.




o Collect, clean, and analyze customer data using various tools and techniques to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.




o Interpret data and provide insights to assist in understanding customer behavior, preferences, and needs.




o Perform root cause analysis on data errors and fix recuring errors.




Customer Engagement and Feedback:




o Interact with customers to gather feedback, understand their requirements, and identify pain points.


Data Visualization and Reporting:




o Create visually appealing and easy-to-understand dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate insights and findings to both internal and external stakeholders.




o Provide regular updates and insights to the team and management based on the analysis of customer data.


Security and Compliance


o Protects company data at all times.


o Educates oneself on security measures to protect company property (e.g. shoulder surfing, phishing attacks, etc)


o Be aware of all potential threats and surroundings.


o Never write down information from your computer’s monitor.


o Do not share any company information unless you have confirmed that person’s identity.


o Maintains knowledge of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and the ClearBalance policies that support compliance with BSA.


o Performs all duties in a manner that fully supports compliance with all laws and ClearBalance policies.

Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnected from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food, and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use, and recycle products. We’re driven by our passion for sustainability, ESG and waste reduction.

Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo.

We are growing fast and need people that want to be part of the journey, commercializing Sensing as a Service and enabling “Intelligence for Everyday Things”.

This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in tactical data exploration and to build out solutions on top of the insights you identify. Working with fortune 500 customers on innovative data products, you will sift through massive amounts of data to discover “Ah ha!” moments for key customers that connect the dots between our technology and their key problems. You will then work with internal teams to turn these insights into integrated solutions. Creativity, curiosity, and resilience are key for this role as you often won’t know what we’re looking for until we’ve found it.

Golin is seeking a Digital/Social Junior Analyst to join our Dallas office. This role is hybrid, with the expectation of 2 days a week in the office working with Golin colleagues, and a 3rd day spent onsite with clients as needed.

This is an awesome opportunity for anyone who loves to solve problems, make strategic recommendations, and consult on digital campaigns to join Golin and have an immediate impact.

If you've spent time in the data exported from Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and other platforms – you might be our perfect fit. This role is about connecting the dots between something you saw in Twitter Analytics, a finding from Instagram, and a trend from your favorite brand on social. Then you need to use your findings to make a strategic recommendation for Golin clients.

From there, you have to sell it. In a lot of ways, the internal Golin team is both your ally and your client. You have to make them believe in the recommendations that you are making. This can take the form of a quick, but well-informed email, a meeting on Teams, or a formal presentation deck with cool visualizations that help tell your story. That's why our ideal candidate not only has an interest in how social media campaigns tick, but at the core, is a great marketer and communicator. This is a must.

This role isn't a business analytics role. It's a PR, marketing and comms role for people with an interest in data and understanding what makes a marketing campaign tick.

What You'll Do:

Each day will be dynamic and full of strategic decisions, constantly changing priorities and creative discovery. You will be accountable to:

Serve as a creative, analytical mind on the team to provide strategic recommendations for developing and improving social media campaigns
Use web and social media analytics platforms to measure campaign success and provide data-backed recommendations for optimization
Use Excel to the max, analyzing media coverage for trends and patterns that inform recommended actions
Serve as a data journalist by uncovering strategic findings and insights using a range of digital analytics techniques, such as social listening, to help support business objectives, advance storytelling, and drive engagement
Work closely with senior manager to compile, synthesize and analyze data sets. As well as, assisting with report creation and presenting to clients.
Understand client background and needs, including general business strategy, industry issues, products and services, key customers and competitors in the marketplace
Understand social channels and identify emerging opportunities for a diverse client set

What you have:

Coursework in some form of marketing analysis, journalism, PR, mathematics, statistics and/or social science is preferred
Basic understanding of principles of communications, digital marketing, and news media
Strong verbal and written communication, organizational and time-management
Experience working with or interest in data visualization tools and creative ways to display information
Keen eye for data trends and the ability to investigate and articulate factors that may account for these trends
Show enthusiasm, passion and curiosity about digital/social analytics
Possess critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Know how to prioritize and be adaptive to change
Be highly motivated and eager to learn

Requirements:

You must have your Bachelor's degree
2+ years' experience
You must have knowledge and be comfortable working in Microsoft Office tools, specifically Excel. You must know what a Pivot Table is and know how to use it.

About Us:

We are a progressive public relations agency designed to reach the profoundly diverse market. Our progressive approach aligns earned-first, data-driven creative with the customer journey, to build relevance and deliver maximum impact for our clients. To be successful with our employees and our clients, inclusion is a core value for Golin and we are focused on establishing a culture that is intentionally inclusive, profoundly diverse and uncompromisingly equitable.

Our expertise ranges from brand-building and cutting-edge campaigns, to corporate reputation, advocacy and consumer insights. Golin aligns earned-first, data-driven creative with the customer journey through our collaborative G4 Model to deliver maximum impact for clients. Our roster includes many of the largest CPG, retail, food, healthcare technology and consumer service companies in the world.

Salary range: $50,000 - $70,000

Description:

By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility. Your Mission is Ours.

Sustainment is our tether to the customer. A lifeline that links Lockheed Martin to the front lines. An added layer of trust, demonstrating to our customer that their mission is our mission. Sustainment is what separates Lockheed Martin from the competition. As a Sustainment Support Specialist, your day to day duties will ensure our Lockheed Martin products are ready when are customer needs them, provide the best possible outcomes by using analytic driven solutions, and lower operating cost through dynamic data driven problem solving.

A Sustainment Support Specialist will perform:

World-class customer service
o Daily actions, no matter how small or large, play a critical role to ensure our Nation’s security is ready for threats near or far.


High level problem solving with real-world implications
o Using advanced analytics will provide insights into global supply inventories for LM products across the world. This data will ensure that parts are located, deployed, and secured on the flight line when our customers need them.


Reliability and Maintainability measures
o Forecasting maintenance using predictive health data, minimizing unscheduled downtime, reducing operating costs and keeping our products airworthy.

In this role, you will collaborate with our team to deploy advanced analytics for predictive health, enabling precise forecasting of maintenance actions and informing supply requirements. By implementing enhanced reliability, diagnostics, and new technologies, you will contribute to minimizing unscheduled maintenance, ensuring the highest level of system reliability for our customers. Furthermore, your knowledge of design principles will be beneficial in optimizing aircraft maintenance planning and execution, leading to improved mission readiness and fleet availability. Additional responsibilities include:


Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, integrate, test, and sustain complex systems and solutions for aerospace and defense applications.
Perform system modeling, simulation, and analysis to ensure the performance, reliability, and safety of developed systems.
Implement innovative technologies and industry best practices to drive continuous improvement to field performance.

Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Experience with stakeholder/customer relationship management


Ability to understand and analyze data and metrics as well as conduct root cause analysis and propose corrective actions.


Strong problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail and an ability to think critically in a high tempo customer-centered environment.


Excellent communication and teamwork skills, enabling effective collaboration with diverse teams and stakeholders.

Chalk Mountain Services of Texas, LLC (“Chalk”) is a leader in transportation and logistics servicing the oil and gas extraction industry. The Company is based in Fort Worth, TX and is currently hiring an Operations Data Analyst.

The Data Analyst will provide enhanced management reports and a high-quality budgeting and forecasting analysis. They will utilize technical expertise to ensure data is accurate and high-quality. Data is then analyzed and presented in a way that identifies errors, irregularities, and opportunities for financial and operational improvement so to assist the business in making better decisions.

Responsibilities

REPORTING:

· Develop financial and management reports which clearly and concisely illustrate operational, financial, and forensic performance. Continue to enhance reporting as requirements change.

Maintain and distribute the various reporting package templates for management and operational personnel.
Assist CFO in the presentation of findings in monthly board reports and other presentations.
Prepare ad hoc reports as required.

PLANNING:

Assist with the development and ongoing measurement of Key Performance Indicators utilized to measure operational performance and incentive bonus calculations.
Create forecasting models based upon historical data and pertinent forecast data designed to project Key Performance Indicators and other critical assumptions used in the Company’s forecasting process.
Provide additional support for the annual/monthly forecasting process.

ANALYSIS:

Review business performance data on a continuous basis. Identify errors and irregularities in the data and identify opportunities for improvement in operational and financial performance in such data. Such efforts include but are not limited to:
Development of metric forecasts and subsequent variance analysis.
Drill down analysis of data and metrics designed to identify underlying relationships between operational behavior and results.

Treasury Data Analyst II
The Treasury Data Analyst II produces information that will assist Corporate Treasury in the effective management of Comerica's various balance sheet initiatives. This includes providing data analytics, visualization, and automation to various teams within Corporate Treasury to support financial modeling and reporting in response to business needs and regulatory requirements.




Comerica’s Corporate Treasury Department is growing! As a result of our growth, we are seeking top talent to join our team. Be a part of an innovative and collaborative team. Apply today.




Position Responsibilities:

Support Corporate Treasury's effort in preparing for Enhanced Prudential Standards requirements (Basel III, LCR, 2052a, NSFR, etc.).
Developing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that support effective internal reporting, such as: Liquidity Risk - Data needs around liquidity stress testing, key risk indicators, and various other analysis; Capital Management - stress testing, capital forecasting and sensitivity analysis; ALM - behavioral modeling, including deposit betas, deposit lives, balance sheet sensitivity.
Support data and automation needs of the Funding, Portfolio, ALM, Liquidity and Capital teams for reporting to ALCO, ERRC, Board, regulators, IR, Accounting, etc.
Support medium to large complex data and technology projects, including regulatory reporting (2052a, capital stress testing), LCR, NSFR, and other information delivered by Treasury to support various regulatory reporting requirements.
Provide data tracking and analytics in support of various Treasury initiatives to streamline recurring data tasks to improve accuracy and provide support for the Treasury department. This role will also monitor processes to ensure smooth information flow from sources to final output. Querying data sources and maintaining databases and source documents.

Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies – ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.

Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation

Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Job Title: Employee Response Center - Call Center Quality Assurance Analyst
Job Description:
Higginbotham, a privately held, independent insurance and financial services firm that ranks within the top 20 nationwide, has an immediate opening for a Employee Response Center - Call Center Quality Assurance Analyst for our Fort Worth, TX office. This is an in office position.

Responsibilities of the ERC Call Center Quality Assurance Analyst are:

Focus on creating a positive and productive working environment while developing and maintaining an organization with a passion for excellence, compliance, and ongoing quality improvement.
Assist Manager with Call Center Quality Programs, technology implementation Call Center Customer Service Excellence Programs as needed.
Evaluate people, process, and technology improvements to enhance Higginbotham’s ability to improve customer satisfaction and maintain compliance.
Collaborate with operational leadership to help educate staff on quality findings, mitigate future quality shortfalls, and enhance quality assurance measures. Provide timely and effective communication to the Leadership Team regarding all issues affecting departments.
Work collaboratively with the ERC Team Leadership to maintain an environment where all Benefit Specialists embrace the common goal of excellence and ensure congruent quality efforts and knowledge transfer.
Formulate recommendations to improve Higginbotham’s call quality, with a focus on maintaining excellent customer service, and improving customer service scores on patient and provider surveys, while driving improvement in NPS scores.
Create and promote a learning environment to enhance performance and to keep up with industry best practices.
Provide oversight to the Ring Central Center to ensure a proactive, action-oriented focus to exceed customer expectations, as well as industry and regulatory quality standards.
Provide the ERC Team Leadership support in the completion of the Benefits Specialists’ daily and monthly tasks and meeting program service levels.
Manage ad-hoc and special projects as requested by Leadership.

Performance Management:

Provide ongoing performance feedback, coaching, and counseling of Supervisors and other Operational Leaders to ensure consistent performance.
Work with leadership to conduct reviews and Internal Disciplinary Plans as defined in the Performance Management process.
Focus on the performance development of individuals on an ongoing basis.
Support all programs in the call center and ensure that all documentation for each process/program is accurate and up to date.
Recommend rewards and recognition methods: coaching, recognition, rewards, providing direct feedback, and written evaluations to enhance personal and professional development.

Training:

Accommodate and support the ERC Team Lead regarding administering additional training for employees.
Assist the Team Lead and help oversee the project plan/training tasks associated with all customer service-related training.
Ensure departmental regulatory compliance and audit readiness.
Promote ongoing staff and organization training and development activities.

Reporting Analytics:

Perform trend analysis and collaborate with Training and Operations to close performance gaps.
Assure that daily, weekly, and monthly reporting is accurately completed and on time.
Work with the ERC Team Lead and Director of Employee Engagement to create/update QA Analyst scorecard.
Work with the Director of Employee Engagement to pull and analyze data reports.
Responsible for analyzing trends that focus on improved performance, increased efficiencies, and overall compliance.

Experience and Education:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience – 3 plus years of professional experience in a call center QA position
One (1) or more years of employee benefits, insurance experience, and customer service in/business/industry experience are required
Must be Bilingual
Be willing to obtain the General Lines Life & Health Insurance License

Specific Knowledge and Qualifications:

Solid knowledge of customer service policies, practices, and systems
Demonstrated employee relations skills, experience leading a team, developing, coaching, providing feedback, and written evaluations to enhance professional development and achievement of goals.
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to successfully adapt to changes that impact the call center volumes.
Knowledge of quality improvement processes and performance measurements.
Demonstrated project management skills.
Previous experience with data management software, data analysis, and reporting.
Ability to be flexible and work consistently in a dynamic and changing environment.
Highly motivated and committed to excellence with a positive attitude.
Possess an outward mindset in leadership.
Excellent organizational, prioritization, and time-management skills.
Ability to communicate effectively, both written and oral.
Strong customer service orientation
Computer proficient
Thorough knowledge of employee benefits, COBRA administration, and insurance and operations
Must be comfortable working with various software programs at the same time.
Must be organized and detail-oriented, self-motivated but not afraid to ask questions.
Needs to be comfortable working with all types of people and on multiple projects simultaneously.

Physical Requirements:

Ability to lift 25 pounds.
Repeated use of sight to read documents and computer screens
Repeated use of hearing and speech to communicate on the telephone and in person
Repetitive hand movements, such as keyboarding, writing, 10-key
Walking, bending, sitting, reaching and stretching in all directions

Leeward Renewable Energy is a high-growth renewable energy asset owner, operator, and development company headquartered in Dallas Texas. Leeward currently owns and operates a portfolio of 28 renewable energy facilities across nine states, totaling close to 3000 MW of installed capacity and is actively developing new wind, solar, and energy storage projects in energy markets across the U.S., with ~20 GW of projects under development spanning over 100 projects. Leeward is a portfolio company of OMERS, one of Canada's largest pension plans with over C$121 billion in assets.
POSITION: Data Analyst
Department: Technical Services
Location: Dallas, Texas
Status: Exempt
Job Summary:
Leeward Renewable Energy is currently seeking a Data Analyst for our renewable energy company. This position will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data related to our wind, solar, and battery storage farms and will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop insights and recommendations that drive operational excellence, enhance performance, and support strategic initiatives. The work will contribute to improving the efficiency, reliability, and profitability of LRE’s renewable energy assets. This position is in Dallas, Texas and provides a perfect opportunity for a professional looking for interesting work within a small team, the ability to expand their experience, work with all levels of the organization, and contribute to the company's success.
Essential Functions:
Collect, cleanse, and analyze data from various sources, including SCADA systems, weather stations, sensors, and other operational data sources.
Develop and maintain databases, data systems, data pipelines, and dashboards to ensure accurate and timely reporting of operational and performance metrics.
Conduct advanced statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and optimization techniques to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in energy production, equipment performance, and maintenance needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, operations, finance, and business development, to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop actionable insights.
Provide regular reports, visualizations, and presentations to communicate findings, recommendations, and performance trends to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Support the development and implementation of data-driven initiatives, such as predictive maintenance, energy forecasting, and asset optimization strategies.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and renewable energy.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data science, statistics, computer science, or engineering. A master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the renewable energy or power industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau or similar.
Knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large and complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset and ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Passion for renewable energy and a commitment to sustainability.
Familiarity with renewable energy systems, including wind turbines, solar panels, and battery storage is a plus.
Physical Demands:
Position will require sitting for long periods of time.
Ability to perform physical requirements including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, twisting, reaching, and climbing at project locations to inspect and repair equipment or collect information.

At True Velocity, the possibilities are limitless and so is the greatness of our team members. We are seeking creative, open-minded, and enthusiastic individuals to join our team. We have an opening for an Database Administrator and Power BI Analyst to join our growing team.

Proven experience in database administration with Oracle and SQL databases.

Familiarity with Manufacturing Operations and the ability to translate business requirements into effective reports.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and translate data insights into actionable recommendations.

Sitting, standing, and walking (up to continuously); frequent use of computer and telephone requiring repetitive finger, hand, and arm movement; occasionally carry office supplies and other miscellaneous items up to 50 pounds. Continuous use of seeing, hearing, verbal communication.

Working in an indoor setting and manufacturing environment. Position is based at our Nicholson location in Garland, TX. This position is Full-Time.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Odoo ERP Business Analyst (BA) to join our dynamic team. As an Odoo ERP BA, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes in the Odoo ERP system to streamline operations, improve efficiency, and enhance overall business performance. Your primary focus will be understanding the business needs of various departments and translating them into functional and technical requirements for successful Odoo ERP system deployment and customization.
Roles And Responsibilities
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Business Analyst, preferably in Odoo ERP projects
In-depth knowledge of Odoo ERP modules and configurations.
Business Process Analysis: Collaborate with key stakeholders from different departments to understand their business processes, pain points, and requirements. Analyze existing workflows and propose optimized solutions using Odoo ERP modules and features.
Requirement Gathering: Elicit, document, and prioritize functional and technical requirements from stakeholders, ensuring they align with the organization & strategic goals.
Solution Design: Design and model functional solutions within Odoo ERP, considering system capabilities, scalability, and best practices. Recommend customizations or configurations to address specific business needs.

The fact that you landed here indicates there may be something missing in your work. Maybe you are not feeling challenged in the work you do, or perhaps you feel like your work has lost its meaning. Here at Andrews, we believe purpose matters, and our stated purpose is “Serving one another in pursuit of being our best.” Are you looking for ways to serve others and discover your best? Do you want to thrive in an environment where you feel appreciated and valued? Let’s take a closer look at the role of a Financial Analyst I to determine if this opportunity is right for you!
The Financial Analyst I – Customer Revenue is responsible for financial research and analysis for use in the development of business strategies and tactics for Customer revenue growth. This role will be a data intensive role focused on top line sales and margin growth. The Financial Analyst – Customer Revenue will focus on competitive pricing/analysis-based competitive strategies, market share growth, financial analyses focused on customers, pricing sensitivity analysis, competitive analyses, vendor analysis and working with external organizations to extract data. This role is part of the Finance, Accounting and Compliance team.
Here’s more of what you will do… (OK, not all in one day!)
The Financial Analyst – Customer Revenue can be expected to perform the following tasks in this role as a routine part of their job:
Develops analytical business solutions and recommends the appropriate use of transactional data, syndicated data and other forms of secondary data available to drive projects throughout Brand, Sales and Planning teams.
Leads analysis to provide business recommendations and solutions focused on competitive pricing/analysis-based competitive strategies, market share growth, financial analyses focused on customers, pricing sensitivity analysis, competitive analyses and vendor analyses.
Fosters a strategic partnership with Brand Leaders by helping guide and recommend portfolio profitability decisions.
Works in conjunction with financial planning and analyses in forecasting, pricing and market share discussions and post evaluations.
Ensures continuous improvement in pricing projects and works with Brand leaders to learn insight from price changes and cascade those learnings to the Brand, Sales and Planning teams.
Develops, maintains and reports on KPIs that drive daily, weekly, and monthly measurement of price changes in the marketplace with pre- and post-analysis.
Collaborates with the Customer Centric Planning team on customer focused projects with the understanding the impact of customer demographics.
Provides the analysis and reports for business planning meetings to ensure the Brand team has information to build a prescriptive activity plan in support of the quarterly Brand Plan with data and analytics.
Provides financial modeling input into business cases, costs, and schedules to support customer growth revenue.
Applies understanding of business strategies, objectives, and environment to develop, recommend and implement solutions.
Collaborates and provides guidance to the Financial, Brand, Sales and Human Resources teams in ad-hoc financial analyses as it relates to revenue growth, market share growth and costs optimization utilizing spatial analytics.
Analyzes multiple levels of data across the company through customer using financial and supplier data.
Maintains data sharing policy and confidentiality across suppliers.
Collaborates with Information Technology and Communications teams as needed to align processes and procedures.
Conducts research using a variety of data sources and selects information needed for the analysis of customer revenue growth.
Partners with Market Intelligence, Pricing Optimization, Category Management, Brand and Sales teams in delivering fact-based selling stories for high-value sales team calls that optimize both customer and Andrews’ profitability potential.
Attends meetings, gathers, researches and analyzes data to provide information identify, quantify, and predict consumer buying behavior.
Produces data, reports and presentations as needed in support of sales processes and goals.
Provides financial analytics and reporting based on best practices and identifies opportunities to improve current processes.
Develops, maintains and reports on customer KPIs.
Provides technical and analysis guidance on analyzing data trends and reports to help guide decision making.
Evaluates opportunities for growth, by supporting Brand leadership in their effectiveness with shared key insights of the market changes in collaboration with the PMO team.
Partners with the Project Management Office (PMO) team to execute projects company-wide.
Uses and follows PMO-recommended process and procedures to ensure alignment.
This is a multi-level role, levels are based on Financial Analysis, Modeling and Data Analysis knowledge, experience and expertise, and complexity of departmental/cross-functional project/process assignments.

MCA, your trusted advisor for wireless communications, data, and security, is seeking an experienced IT Analyst in the Dallas, TX area to support our growing corporate team. The position will be in office.

MCA is building a team of people who share our values of service first, growth, teamwork, and safety. We take our work and customers seriously and believe our best work can be fun. When you join our team, you join the MCA family! We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits, including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Time Off (PTO), Holiday Pay, Education and Certification Incentives and much more.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:


Requirement Analysis: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their technology needs and objectives. Document and analyze these requirements to recommend suitable IT solutions.
System Design: Develop system design and specifications, including data models, architecture, and functional specifications for software or hardware solutions.
Technology Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend new technologies, tools, and software to improve the efficiency, security, and effectiveness of IT systems.
Software Development: Assist in software development and programming tasks as needed, especially in cases where custom solutions are required.
Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues. Provide support to end-users and helpdesk teams in resolving technical problems.
Quality Assurance: Conduct testing and quality assurance activities to ensure the reliability and functionality of IT systems. Identify and address defects and issues.
Documentation: Create and maintain documentation, including technical specifications, system configurations, and user manuals.
Security and Compliance: Monitor and enforce IT security policies and compliance with industry standards and regulations, such as GDPR, HIPAA, or other relevant laws.
Data Analysis: Analyze data to provide insights and reports that can support decision-making processes and business objectives.
Training and Support: Provide training and guidance to end-users and technical support teams on IT systems and applications.
Vendor Management: Collaborate with vendors and external service providers to evaluate and procure IT products and services.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE TEAM:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Strong technical skills and knowledge of various IT systems, software, and hardware.
Proficiency in programming languages, database management, and network protocols.
Project management skills and experience.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of industry best practices, security protocols, and compliance requirements.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CompTIA A+, Network+, or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)) may be required or preferred.

YOUR ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

The physical environment requires the employee to work inside.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to frequently stand, walk, sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear; lift (overhead, waist level) from the floor, bending, frequently utilize near vision use for reading and computer use; occasionally move equipment weighing up to 15 pounds, and frequently position self to maintain computers or other equipment as needed.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

Travel as necessary to support company and customer needs.

DIRECT REPORTS:

No Direct Reports

WHO WE ARE
Mobile Communications America, Inc. (MCA) provides wireless communication, data and security solutions that enhance workplace safety, security, and efficiency nationwide. Customers trust us to provide a portfolio of turn-key systems, products, and services — including two-way radio communications, vehicle uplift, security video and access control systems, BDA/DAS, remote monitoring, GPS tracking, SCADA, dispatch, mass notification, and point-to-point wireless networks. Our more than 60,000 customers span industries such as public safety, commercial, manufacturing, education, healthcare, utilities, and government. In addition to being the largest Motorola partner in the U.S., MCA has strategic partnerships with over 1,000 major manufacturers to offer an extensive portfolio of products and technologies.

WHAT WE BELIEVE
We are better together through the MCA Way: living our core values of Service First, Growth, Teamwork, and Safety. We take our work and customers seriously and believe our best work can be fun. A component of our business that embodies the MCA advantage is our “Service First DNA” culture. Service isn’t just a motto for MCA, and it’s an integral part of who we are and goes beyond our customers to our employees, partners, shareholder, and communities.

An individual who can collaborate with supervisors to identify training gaps and assess agent performance, support the development of call center infrastructure and call routing, on-going support and assessing team efficiency, scheduling opportunities and upscaling / downscaling efforts including roll-on/off of call center staff. Process/Functional Skills:

· Workforce Planning: Assist in the development and implementation of workforce planning strategies to ensure staffing levels align with business goals and operational needs.

· Scheduling: Create and maintain employee schedules, ensuring optimal coverage and adherence to workforce plans while minimizing overstaffing or understaffing.

· Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret workforce data to provide insights into performance, efficiency, and areas for improvement. Generate regular reports on key performance indicators (KPIs).

· Performance Monitoring: Monitor employee performance metrics and attendance data, identifying trends, opportunities, and issues that impact productivity and operational efficiency.

· Resource Allocation: Optimize resource allocation, including equipment, workspaces, and personnel, to support operational needs while minimizing waste and downtime.

· Communication and Coordination: Collaborate with various departments, including HR, operations, and team leaders, to ensure that workforce management aligns with business requirements.

· Training and Development: Identify training and development needs for the workforce, collaborating with HR to plan and implement training programs.

· Technology and Software: Utilize and maintain workforce management software and tools, ensuring data accuracy and system functionality.

· Compliance and Regulations: Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and industry regulations. Stay informed about labor market trends and legislative changes.

· Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation. Implement best practices to enhance workforce efficiency and productivity.

Behavioral Skills:

· Communication: Workforce Specialists need strong communication skills to interact with employees, managers, and other stakeholders. They must be able to convey workforce plans, policies, and changes clearly and effectively.

· Analytical Thinking: Analytical skills are essential for interpreting workforce data and identifying trends that inform decision-making. Workforce Specialists should be able to analyze data and use it to improve efficiency and performance.

· Problem-Solving: The ability to identify workforce-related problems and come up with practical solutions is a key behavioral skill. Workforce Specialists often need to address staffing issues, performance bottlenecks, and resource allocation challenges.

· Teamwork: Collaborative skills are important for working with various departments within the organization, such as HR, operations, and team leaders. A workforce specialist must coordinate efforts to ensure that staffing aligns with business needs.

· Flexibility: Workforce Specialists should be adaptable and open to change. They often need to adjust staffing plans or processes to accommodate fluctuating demand or evolving business priorities.

· Time Management: Effective time management is essential for prioritizing tasks, meeting deadlines, and managing a dynamic workload. Workforce Specialists need to balance multiple responsibilities efficiently.

· Conflict Resolution: Conflict can arise within a workforce, and Workforce Specialists should have the skills to mediate disputes and maintain a harmonious working environment.

· Ethical Decision-Making: Workforce Specialists should uphold ethical standards in personnel management, data handling, and decision-making, especially when handling sensitive employee information.

Qualification:

· A Graduate in any field. Post graduation in MBA or equivalent will be preferred.

Summary:

As a Senior Analyst, Data Governance Operations you will play a pivotal role in driving our data governance initiatives forward. Leveraging your excellent communication skills, you will lead meaningful conversations, host trainings, and foster relationships with various teams across the organization. This role offers the chance to work closely with a diverse set of stakeholders, influencing the way data is viewed, managed, and leveraged across the organization. If you're passionate about data and its potential to drive business success, this could be the perfect role for you.

Responsibilities:
Engage with stakeholders across different functions to understand and address data-related needs and challenges.
Serve as a key point of contact for data stewards and owners across different domains, assisting with onboarding, addressing queries, and ensuring they have the resources and support needed to effectively manage their domains.
Develop and nurture relationships with various teams, positioning the data governance unit as a reliable partner in all data matters.
Assist in the development and updating of training content and materials; host and facilitate training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding and implementation of data governance practices.
Support ongoing data governance projects, ensuring timely execution and alignment with the company's strategic goals.
Assist in maintaining governance documentation, ensuring all processes, policies, and standards are up-to-date and easily accessible for internal teams.
Address data governance related issues, escalating where necessary and ensuring timely resolution.
Support the collection and reporting of data governance metrics, helping to showcase the progress and impact of governance initiatives.

Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Systems, Business Administration) or equivalent experience.


Required qualifications:
Minimum one year of experience supporting data governance operations, data policy, data management, or a related field.

Preferred qualifications:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to facilitate meetings and training sessions effectively.
Knowledge of data governance best practices and principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and a keen ability to build and nurture relationships.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously.

$70,000.00 - $140,000.00

Overview:
The Business Analyst is responsible for enabling self-service data driven decision-making throughout the organization. The position works closely with the Customer Care team to gather requirements for reporting, testing, modeling and data mining exercises, then incorporates all factors of analyzing and tracking to recommend solutions to our business.


What We Stand For
Established in 1978, The Container Store has grown to be the leading specialty retailer of storage and organization products in the United States and the only national retailer solely devoted to the category. We provide creative, multifunctional, customizable storage and organization solutions that help our customers save time, save space and improve the quality of their lives. We foster a culture built around our Foundation Principles, which define how we approach our relationships with our employees, vendors, customers and communities and influence every aspect of our business.
Responsibilities:
Prioritize and Drive to Completion: Manage multiple tasks, drive initiatives to completion, adhere to timelines.

Utilizes proficiency of data and systems to translate complex requests into tangible insights
Serves as the first point of contact for incoming data requests, reporting and dashboard development support, and systems questions from business users
Supports strategic and tactical analytics and reporting projects using the Agile Scrum methodology, including the development, communication and maturation of business requirements
Presents analysis to various stakeholders including executive leadership

Competitive Pay
