Suitable for Federal Employment
Qualifications
You must meet the United States Office of Personnel Management's (OPM) qualification requirements (including specialized experience and/or educational requirements) for the advertised position. You must meet all eligibility and qualifications requirements by the closing date of the job announcement. OPM Qualifications Standards are available here: Management and Program Analysis Series, 0343.

Specialized Experienceis experience that has equipped applicants with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the position to be filled. To be creditable, specialized experience must have been equivalent to at least the next lower grade level in the federal service.

GS-11: the next lower grade level is a GS-09

Specialized experience includes:
Experience supporting administrative processes and programs in an organization to make provide input on the overall effectiveness for program operations.
Experience utilizing tracking and reporting databases to gather information for reporting purposes.
Experience accessing databases, creating queries and reports using applications such as SharePoint, CRM, Microsoft Excel, R, Alteryx, Python, Tableau or a similar visual analytics engine, and/or Intranet Quorum (IQ) or similar browser-based enterprise system.
OR

Education may be substituted for experience at the GS-11 grade level as described in the Education Section of this vacancy

GS-12: the next lower grade level is a GS-11

Specialized experience includes:
Experience overseeing administrative processes and programs in an organization to make provide input on the overall effectiveness for program operations.
Experience managing tracking and reporting databases to gather and disseminate data for reporting purposes.
Experience accessing databases, creating queries and reports using applications such as SharePoint, CRM, Microsoft Excel, R, Alteryx, Python, Tableau or a similar visual analytics engine, and/or Intranet Quorum (IQ) or similar browser-based enterprise system.
Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.
Education

Education may be substituted for experience at the GS-11 grade level if the following is met:

Ph.D. or equivalent doctoral degree (if related); or
3 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree (if related); or
LL.M.
Education can not be substituted for experience at the GS-12 grade level for this position

If this position requires proof of higher education, or you are substituting education for experience, you must submit an unofficial transcript or a list of courses that includes the following information: name of accredited institution, grades earned, completion dates, and quarter and semester hours earned. Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. Please refer to http://www.opm.gov/qualifications/policy/ApplicationOfStds-04.asp for more information. You are not required to submit official documents at this time; copies are sufficient.

Special Instructions for Foreign Education: Qualifying education from colleges and universities in foreign countries must be evaluated in terms of equivalency to that acquired in U.S. colleges and universities. Applicants educated in whole or in part in foreign countries must submit sufficient evidence, including transcripts, to an accredited private organization for an equivalency evaluation of course work and degree. A listing of these accredited organizations can be found on the Department of Education's website - US Department of Education. Another listing of services that can perform this evaluation is available at the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES) website. You must provide a copy of the letter containing the results of the equivalency evaluation with a course by course listing along with your application. Failure to provide such documentation when requested will result in lost consideration.

NOTE: Only education and experience acquired before the filing deadline will be considered. Report only attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

Additional information

If you are a male applicant born after December 31, 1959, you must certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System. If you are exempt from registration under Selective Service Law, you must provide appropriate proof of exemption. Please visit the Selective Service System website for more information.

Personally Identifiable Information (PII)
Personally Identifiable Information (PII) is defined as information that can be traced back to a specific individual and potentially compromise their security or privacy. Examples of PII include: date of birth, Social Security Number, and place of birth.

Please ensure that you have removed all Personally Identifiable Information from all documents prior to submitting or uploading your applications material.

Next steps

You will receive a notice generated by the USAJobs System when you have successfully submitted your application.

You will be notified of your application status through USAJOBS at four points during the hiring process, as applicable. You can check the status of your application by accessing the USAJOBS website at http://usajobs.gov/ and clicking on "Track Your Online Application." The four points of notification are:

1. Application Received or Application Incomplete;
2. Minimum Qualification Requirement Met or Minimum Qualification Requirement Not Met;
3. Eligible (Application Referred to the Selecting Official) or Eligible (Application Not Referred to the Selecting Official); and
4. Selected or Not Selected

After all application packages have been received, we will review your application and transcript(s) (if you are qualifying based on education) to ensure you meet the basic qualification requirements. We will evaluate each applicant who meets the basic qualifications on the information provided and you may be contacted for follow-up supplemental documentation. It is the applicant's responsibility to provide any supplemental documents or information requested by the Office of Human Resources within the allocated timeframes.

You will be required to submit official documentation prior to appointment. The agency will then verify the information provided on your application (i.e., degree, veterans' preference, disability, etc.). You can check the status of your application by logging into USAJOBS. You may also sign up to receive automatic emails anytime the status of your application has changed by logging into your USAJobs Account, editing your profile and changing the "Notification Settings" to indicate that you want to be notified by email when the status changes. Information regarding the status of your application should be updated in the system within 2 weeks after the closing date of this job announcement.

PLEASE NOTE: Applicants who meet the minimum eligibility and qualification requirements for this position may be contacted within 7 business days of the closing date of this announcement to submit follow-up supporting documentation if applicable. Veterans' Preference Documentation: If you are a veteran with preference eligibility, you will be asked to submit a copy of your DD-214 containing your discharge disposition, dates of service, and rank. If you are a preference eligible claiming a service-connected disability of 10 percent or more, you will be asked to submit documentation (i.e., a letter dated 1991 or later from the Department of Veterans Affairs or from a branch of the Armed Forces) certifying to the veteran's present receipt of compensation. Veterans must include dates of military service within the automated application process and submit a copy of each Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty, DD-214. For more information, please visit Feds Hire Vets.

3. Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP) or Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP) documents -

CTAP applicants MUST submit the following documents: 1. A copy of your RIF separation notice, notice of proposed removal for declining a directed geographic relocation outside of the local commuting area; a Certificate of Expected Separation (CES); or certification that you are in a surplus organization or occupation (this could be a position abolishment letter, a notice of eligibility for discontinued service retirement, or similar notice); 2. A copy of your SF-50 "Notification of Personnel Action", noting current position, grade/band level, and duty location; 3. A copy of your latest performance appraisal including your rating; and 4. Any documentation from your bureau/operating unit that shows your current promotion potential.

ICTAP applicants MUST submit the following documents: 1. A copy of your RIF separation notice, notice of proposed removal for declining a directed geographic relocation outside of the local commuting area, notice of disability annuity termination, certification from your former agency that it cannot place you after your recovery from a work-related compensable injury; or certification from the National Guard Bureau or Military Department that you are eligible for disability retirement; 2. A copy of your SF-50 "Notification of Personnel Action", documenting your RIF separation, noting your position, grade/band level, and duty location, and/or Agency certification of inability to place you through RPL, etc.; 3. A copy of your latest performance appraisal including your rating; and 4. Any documentation from your agency that shows your current promotion potential.

You can upload your documents when you register or update your information on the Dept. of Commerce site which you access through the USAJobs site.

Overview:
The Logistics Analyst is responsible for ensuring The Container Store’s import and domestic vendor shipments are managed efficiently, in a cost-effective manner, while maintaining service levels and planned deadlines. This position will accomplish this by gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data and offer actionable recommendations to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance overall logistics performance. This position works closely with the Buying, Planning, DC Operations, Accounting, and third-party transportation providers (3PLs) and will directly impact the success and competitiveness of our company.

What We Stand For
Established in 1978, The Container Store has grown to be the leading specialty retailer of storage and organization products in the United States and the only national retailer solely devoted to the category. We provide creative, multifunctional, customizable storage and organization solutions that help our customers save time, save space and improve the quality of their lives. We foster a culture built around our Foundation Principles, which define how we approach our relationships with our employees, vendors, customers and communities and influence every aspect of our business.
Responsibilities:
Oversees daily communication and coordination with import and domestic vendors and 3PLs for status updates, accurate documentation needs, service changes, and resolves potential risks
Collects and analyzes data related to logistics, including transportation costs, and supplier performance to gain performance and cost insights and drive solutions
Generates routine and ad-hoc reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) in logistics and develops dashboards and reports that provide a clear view of logistics performance metrics
Collaborates with cross-functional teams, such as Buyer and Distribution Center teams, to identify areas of improvement in the supply chain and proposes and implements changes based on data-driven insights to enhance logistics efficiency and cost-effectiveness
Analyzes and negotiates transportation rates and provides quotes to internal teams; audits and approves logistics related expenses
Partners with Buying and Distribution Center teams on hot shipments and campaign orders which includes freight prioritization and status tracking updates
Escalates the resolution of missed ship windows and any delays that may occur between vendors and The Container Store Distribution Centers.
Maintains understanding of various business divisions within The Container Store and their strategic goals. Stays updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to ensure that the company remains at the forefront of logistics analytics and operational capabilities
The Benefits of Working Here
Our benefits exemplify our commitment to ensuring employees and their families are well taken care of, safe and secure. Some of our benefits include:
Competitive Pay
Medical/Dental/Vision Plans
Discount: 50% on Elfa, 40% on Merchandise and Gift Cards, 25% on Avera
Paid Time Off plus Holidays
401(k) plan with Company Match
Employee First Fund: providing grants to employees experiencing unforeseen emergencies
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in logistics is preferred.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in logistics or supply chain
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)
Ability to work well independently, as well as effectively contribute to a team environment
Strong problem-solving skills, a faculty for numerical detail and the ability to manage complexity
Able to direct multiple projects and anticipate challenges
Must be comfortable adapting regulatory trends and statutes and adjusting processes and requirements as necessary
Experience with expediting and improvement initiatives
Familiar with Customs entry and CTPAT processes
Based in Dallas/Ft. Worth area on a hybrid schedule
Must be at least 18 years of age
The Container Store promotes a smoke-free, drug-free environment.

About Copart

Ally and Your Career
Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams, and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too?
The Opportunity




As a leader in digital financial services, our customer and employee experiences run on data. We depend on the Ally analytics community to fuel these journeys and to help nearly 10,000 leaders and employees make countless data-driven decisions every day.

Reporting to the Director of Strategy & Analytics, this position's primary responsibilities will include strategy development and performance analysis to optimize portfolio results. The ideal candidate must be passionate about delivering results, must be an innovative and strategic thinker, willing to challenge status quo, can learn quickly, is self-motivated, detail oriented, and can sift through voluminous amounts of information to pinpoint which items are relevant to understanding Business results. They will be able to apply knowledge of business and balanced judgment in interpretation of data (analytics).
The Work Itself
Provide analytical and data support in the design and review of strategy tests and current operations.
Analyze monthly operating results and monthly variances; identify problems and research potential recommendations for corrective actions.
Perform portfolio analytics, special projects, drill down analysis and other duties as needed.
Apply sound control processes into daily/weekly/monthly processes to effectively identify, assess, and manage risk.
Maintain code logic to pull, sanitize, aggregate, conform, and produce operational and portfolio-level reports accurately.
Collaboratively work with business and operations partners to ensure alignment with Ally’s strategic imperatives.

Title: Configuration and Data Management Analyst

Client: Bell

Duration: fulltime/contract

Job Description:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes; communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

Review program engineering configuration control methodology and variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and maintained
Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new or changing requirements.
Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and suppliers).
Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders before, during and after the sessions.
Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item Deliverable (DID) requirements.
Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable information.
Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system migration.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or 4-year degree is required
Must have certification in configuration management
Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data management, administrative or office environment experience
Familiarity with ENOVIA.
Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software, data management software, and document imaging software.
Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated markings.
Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures required to execute the change process, configuration management, data management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.

Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid parental leave
Vision insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

Under the direction of the Director of Employment and Compensation, the Compensation Analyst II performs a variety of professional, technical, and analytical compensation duties related to the maintenance, implementation and administration of the university’s compensation policies and programs.

Compensation Analyst I:

Intermediate to advanced skills in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Brief Overview of Position
The Analyst role is a part of a cohesive Risk Analytics team under the Chief Risk Officer’s organization. The role requires credit risk analysis, credit rating analytics, credit risk reporting, Allowance for Credit Losses (ACL), and new data science techniques and methodologies to support risk management. The primary purpose of this job is to support credit scorecards calibration, credit risk database management, and reporting. The Data Analyst will support scorecards models, credit risk data management and governance, regulatory reporting, and CECL reporting and will serve as a liaison with Credit Risk Officers, IT, and similar supporting divisions of the Bank. The Data Analyst will also need the ability to perform any ad-hoc analysis to support overall portfolio and Credit/LOB analytics. This role requires work coordination with Finance, Accounting, Credit Administration, Risk Management, Model Development, and Data Management.
Responsibilities
Support credit rating scorecard statistical calibrations and scorecard database.
Support maintenance of credit risk databases, controls, and documentation aligned with data governance standards and regulatory reporting.
Acquire, interpret, and analyze data to support management in developing and maintaining a statistical database to analyze trends and patterns relating to the credit function.
Maintain and further develop the production of monthly portfolio information and concentration reports for the Board of Directors and senior management.
Perform ACL analytics support for ongoing production, including review of data elements to ensure accuracy, potential new data repositories (as coordinated), ad-hoc data analysis, and sensitivity analysis.
Prepare communication materials and technical documentation, including methodology descriptions consistent with regulatory guidance.
Support documentation, monitoring, and validation of the models.
Cross-functional relationships - coordinate with the IT groups, accounting policy, and finance functions.
Communication with model validation, internal auditors, external auditors, and external regulators.
Partner with risk and lines of business teams to develop analytic solutions, ad-hoc analysis, and modeling to drive new initiatives, improve business processes and deliver value using data-driven decisions.
Provide data science and modeling expertise to others involved in designing credit risk strategies and solutions.
The duties listed above are the essential functions or fundamental duties within the job classification. The essential functions of individual positions within the classification may differ. Texas Capital Bank may assign reasonably related additional duties to individual employees consistent with standard departmental policy.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with courses in finance, accounting, statistics, computer science, information systems, mathematics, or other quantitative sciences. (Master’s degree preferred).
Minimum of two (2) years of experience in quantitative analysis/modeling, credit policy, or credit risk management in the financial services industry.
Proven record of strong work ethics with a commitment to transparency, accountability, and collaborative work.
Proficiency with SQL, Python, and R and the associated analytics packages.
Proficiency in MS Office, especially MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
Exposure to AWS, Microsoft Azure, Power BI, and Shiny is desirable.
A demonstrated ability as an independent thinker with strong analytical, problem solving, technical, attention to detail, communication capabilities, and ability to handle multiple projects.
Understanding of credit risk modeling and data management, database concepts, and data structures.
Understanding of credit risk management discipline, principles, and regulatory requirements – GAAP, CECL accounting standard, CCAR.
Ability to collaborate effectively and follow up to ensure achievement of deadlines, outcomes, and results.
Ability to communicate appropriately and effectively with all organization members and effectively present information verbally and in writing within and across the team.
Self-motivated and strong interpersonal skills to actively lead and implement ideas in a cross-functional team environment.
The duties listed above are the essential functions, or fundamental duties within the job classification. The essential functions of individual positions within the classification may differ. Texas Capital Bank may assign reasonably related additional duties to individual employees consistent with standard departmental policy.

Position Summary:
The Business Process Improvement Analyst will lead the development of process analytics, key performance indicators and business process management methodologies. This key position will act as primary lead and interface between various stakeholders from multiple business, project management, technology services, architecture, and data services teams. This person is expected to draw from their business background and analytical expertise to define, measure, analyze, improve, and develop control processes for change management and process improvement engagements across the broader organization.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Analyzes problems and designs process improvement solutions.
Selects, collects, and analyzes data to find root causes of performance issues.
Assesses process designs for gaps and other impediments by implementing improvement solutions.
Summarizes analysis to report on key improvement opportunities to use for future state solution design.
Works with compliance and legal teams to develop and update policies and procedures.
Creates process maps, SOPs, and other solutions design documentation.
Creates metrics to track benefits of improvement implementations.
Performs change management activities including developing and delivering training and communications to support transition of improvement project changes.
Maintains progress and provides visibility into project activities to complete deliverables on time.
Runs meetings with project teams to communicate deadlines and identify issues and risks.
Maintains and communicates project plan progress, issues, and risks.
Reports status and escalates issues to leadership.
This is not a work from home opportunity.

Overview and Responsibilities:

At Republic Finance, we are building a leading consumer lending company. In business for more than 70 years, we are proud to be a trusted lender in over 250 communities across the United States! We specialize in providing flexible lending solutions and incomparable customer service. Driven by our shared mission to pursue excellence for our team, our customers, and our performance, Republic Finance is continuously improving our online customer offerings in tandem with opening more branches in new states each year. We also regularly promote from within and enjoy giving back to the communities we serve. In a nutshell, our company culture is about helping customers, investing in our employee's future, and ensuring that our overall performance makes an impact on our community.

We are seeking a Sr. Business Analyst for our Operations Analytics and Loss Mitigation Strategy team. This is a key role with significant and broad responsibilities and will be a member of a 3-4 person team with substantial opportunity for future growth within the company in concert with driving business expansion. As a team-member responsible for developing recovery strategies that balance growth, risk and profitability, you will be a key thought leader on all collections strategies and decisions and have significant input into all loss mitigation decisions and delinquency performance. You will work closely with operations, Branch managers, and internal/external partners to collaborate on broader strategic initiatives and shape the direction and growth of the overall business in a collaborative dynamic team environment. Come and be a part of our success story! Job responsibilities are as follows:




Continuously challenge and enhance loss mitigation strategies and scorecards through analysis of customer behavior data and sophisticated statistical and financial modeling.
Maintain a rigorous performance monitoring framework and management dashboards to highlight performance trends and areas of opportunity.
Develop best-in-class loss mitigation products that provide our consumers solutions while minimizing portfolio risk.
Establish a robust test and learn environment for continual loss mitigation and collections strategy improvement.
Build and maintain a robust economic framework that will serve as the foundation for business decision-making.
Ensure loss mitigation policy remains compliant with all applicable laws and regulations.
Maintain transparent communication and trust with all key stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM major is required, advanced degree is preferred.
2-4 years of experience as an analyst in lending originations or loss mitigation.
Experience with statistical modeling and forecasting, portfolio P&L simulation, vintage profitability tracking and marginal expansion strategies.
Familiarity with loss mitigation and collections strategies, loss forecasting, and/or collections KPI’s
1+ years of experience with SQL and/or Python querying required.
Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, a high level of initiative, intellectual curiosity and creativity
A robust understanding of the consumer lending business that includes the various facets of a specialty lending operation.
Familiarity with conducting monthly loan-level and segment-level delinquency forecasts.

Job Title

Senior Technical Business Analyst

Summary of the role:

The the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is looking for a Shopping and Pricing Subject Matter Expert - Airlines; to be able to understand the technical and functional complexity of Shopping and Pricing software system, provide expertise and premium assistance to airlines and manage internal communication with other divisions and with customer. The mission of the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is to offer travel search and travel solution pricing expertise to major customers such as Expedia, Kayak, Southwest, Air Canada and Delta. Our scalable platform is massively distributed, and integrated to the huge Amadeus ecosystem managing massive traffic daily. We are offering a large panel of products and integrated solutions orchestrating flows and providing assistance to the customer on the entire end-to-end process of search for a flight solution, tailor and price it, book and issue the ticket, including the possibility of repricing and reissuance for a change of journey. Southwest and Hawaiian airlines are major customers in the region and we need a technical business analyst able to understand the technical and functional complexity of this software ecosystem, provide expertise and premium assistance to them and manage internal communication with other divisions and with customer. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills on different kinds of tasks

In this role you'll:

Act as primary entry point in areas requiring expertise
For transversal solution escalation points
Analyze and capture solution elements for large cross functional CPs, and other complex cross-organization, cross-functional
solutions
Respond to the needs of the Central and/or Regional commercial organization in close collaboration with all Pdef and Dev teams of the division
Identify areas of repeat/common use and document coherent, re-usable solution responses
Provide support and expertise to Product, Sales and Account teams in functional, technical recommendation for new solution including
Contribute and support in the preparation of RFI/P responses and other ad hoc customer requests
Provide recommendation for new solution in collaboration with R&D teams and coordinate input
Analyze needs and requirements, from customer and internal sources, and propose functional/technical solution recommendations with supporting rationale
Document and present solution recommendations
Support new business opportunity study when it comes to complex solution
Develop, Maintain and share solution analysis and expertise with the wider division
Define and execute the communication/training strategy
Build and deliver Training material: tutorials, user guide, videos
Define , develop and implement communication between commercial organization and R&D organization on complex solution or escalation.
Design the tools which will support the process, taking into account User Experience principles
Track and Measure the performance of the overall functional/technical solution determination processes and propose and implement improvements.

About the Ideal Candidate:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of experience in the offered role, IT travel industry, technical business analysis, product definition, or in another related position.
Airline IT end-to-end business understanding with a particular focus on the Pricing, Ticket change and reissuance, after sale.
Flight Search knowledge and undestanding of the complexity of the search problems and customer espectations on KPIs (Response time, Price Accuracy, Content and cheapest price findability).
Knowledge on business specificities on American customers (Southwest, AirCanada, Kayak Fareportal, Expedia ...) would be appreciated.
Computing Knowledge: Linux Systems, Knowledge in C/C++ and Python preferred
Languages: English is a must, French is a plus
Specific Knowledge: EDIFACT protocol, Pricing, Airline Fare filing. Data analytics knowledge/interest preferred
Other Knowledge: Communication skills, team work, Software Development Methodologies (Agile and Waterfall), Coordination Skills, Leadership. Experience with customer and premium support.
Ability to travel 5% within the US, France and Canada

What we can offer you:

Get rewarded with competitive remuneration, individual and company annual bonus, vacation and holiday paid time off, health insurances and other competitive benefits.
Professional development to broaden your knowledge and enhance your skills with on-line learning hubs packed with technical and soft skills training that allow you to develop and grow.
Enter a diverse and inclusive workplace, join one of the world’s top travel technology companies and take on a role that impacts millions of travelers around the globe.

Job Description :
Job Purpose:
The Analyst – Nursing Reporting and Analytics specializes in reports impacting nursing departments rolling up to the SVP/Chief Nursing Executive for MHS wholly-owned facilities, including areas like nursing key performance indicators, medical staff utilization, transfer center operations, strategic planning, and operational decision-making. The Analyst applies appropriate statistical analyses, data quality control, and data normalization to all reports. Educates staff and medical staff on projects, developments, and use of data. Serves as an “interpreter” for statistical analyses. Assesses the information needs and capabilities of stakeholders, partnering with them to support change that is data-driven. Provides assessments for organizational prioritization of initiatives and evaluation of departments/projects. Oversees the design, production, integration, and analysis of data and collaborates with associated data custodians to inform strategic and operational decision-making. Supports the mission, vision, values and strategic goals of Methodist Health System.

Adults: 35+ years – 65 years

Education:
Minimum: Bachelor's degree in healthcare, public health, mathematics, statistics, business, information systems, or a related field, or work experience of four years or more.
Required Experience:
A minimum of two years of relevant experience, including data management, business analytics, biostatistics, electronic medical records, or quality improvement. Experience in healthcare preferred. Graduate education in a related field will be considered toward experience.
One year of experience with management of large datasets and creating detailed reports for internal and external stakeholders is preferred.

None
Related Work Experience and Other Skills:
Able to assess the needs of a growing business and develop analytic tools that make clear recommendations and allow stakeholders to make data-driven decisions.
Preferred: Working knowledge of continuous process improvement methodologies.
Passionate about designing impactful presentations and communicating data insights to internal and external stakeholders at a variety of technical levels.
Executes work with an attention to detail, a strong sense of personal accountability for high quality, accurate, and error-free deliverables, and a commitment to maintaining data integrity.
Proficient in a data analysis and visualization software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, SAS) and/or a database management software (e.g., Microsoft Access, Microsoft SQL Server).
Preferred: Experienced in analyzing Epic data (e.g., Reporting Workbench, Slicer Dicer, Transfer module, Patient Placement module).
Demonstrates analytical skills, problem-solving skills, and learning agility.
Possesses superior written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills with a commitment to keeping stakeholders engaged and updated.
Able to work both independently with a strong work ethic and collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment.
Serves as a dependable and energetic self-starter with a curiosity for learning and a desire to support a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
Methodist Health System is a faith-based organization with a mission to improve and save lives through compassionate, quality healthcare. For nearly a century, Dallas-based Methodist Health System has been a trusted choice for health and wellness. Named one of the fastest-growing health systems in America by Modern Healthcare, Methodist has a network of 12 hospitals (through ownership and affiliation) with nationally recognized medical services, such as a Level I Trauma Center, multi-organ transplantation, Level III Neonatal Intensive Care, neurosurgery, robotic surgical programs, oncology, gastroenterology, and orthopedics, among others. Methodist has more than two dozen clinics located throughout the region, renowned teaching programs, innovative research, and a strong commitment to the community. What’s Under the Hood
Bridgecrest, one of the country’s leading financial servicing providers, services roughly $15 billion in finance receivables for DriveTime and other third parties. We service auto loans across a wide credit spectrum with the intent of creating a strong path to vehicle ownership for our customers.
Bridgecrest recently launched its newest affiliate GoFi. Established in 2022, GoFi is headquartered in Dallas, Texas with a mission to deliver a comprehensive, fully integrated auto finance product allowing the best brands to deliver the best customer experience. By implementing state of the art technology, we provide an off-the-shelf service to make integration with GoFi as seamless as possible.
That’s Nice, But What’s the Job?
This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas or who need sponsorship now or in the future are not eligible for hire at this time.
In short the Senior Analyst, Pricing Analytics will leverage intelligent test design and analysis of large datasets to craft pricing strategies that accomplish our organizational initiatives of growth, and profitability in an emerging branch of the company
In long the Senior Analyst, Pricing Analytics is responsible for:
Designing, implementing and monitoring market pricing tests to understand the impact of price on capture rates.
Have a direct hand in creating the initial policies & programs for new product launches, including creating a monitoring suite to assess the success of the launch
Creating in-depth analyses, collaborate with stakeholders, and leverage resources skillfully to capitalize on those new opportunities.
Demonstrating strong communication skills in making recommendations to senior executives across DriveTime’s family of companies.
Constructing in-depth quantitative analysis by processing, manipulating, and studying large datasets by leveraging strong coding skills in languages such as Python, SQL, Snowflake, and R.
Being self-driven and able to take initiative to further the success of the business.
So What Kind of Folks Are We Looking for?
Killer analytical and story-telling abilities. You’ll need the capability to analyze data and in return, prepare a well-crafted narrative on your findings in the form of presentations and monitoring reports.
Intellectual curiosity & humility. Why? What? How? Do you find yourself always wanting to learn more and broaden your knowledge base in a team-oriented environment? If so, this could be the role for you.
Passionate and goal oriented. We are looking for someone that is enthusiastic about their work and is passionate about not only meeting their goals but exceeding them.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
The Specifics
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as economics, finance, statistics, engineering, computer information systems or other STEM field.
1+ years of experience in data, financial, and/or strategic analytics;
Experience with pricing test design & analysis of price elasticity a plus
Experience using analysis to create value-added strategies and make recommendations to the business to improve organizational performance
Exceptional problem-solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail.
Experience with coding languages such as Python, SQL, Snowflake, and/or R skills.
Demonstrated skill and extended extensive experience with developing quantitative analysis in Excel
Experience in creating actional reporting through Tableau or PowerBI.
So What About the Perks? Perks matter
Medical, dental, and vision, oh my! DriveTime Family of Brands covers a sizable amount of insurance premiums to ensure our employees receive top-tier healthcare coverage.
But Wait, There’s More. 401(K), Company paid life insurance policy, short and long-term disability coverage to name a few.
Growth Opportunities. You grow, I grow, we all grow! But seriously, DriveTime Family of Brands is committed to providing its employees with every opportunity to grow professionally with roughly over 1,000 employees promoted year over year.
Tuition Reimbursement. We’re as passionate about your professional development as you are. With that, we’ll put our money where our mouth is.
Wellness Program. Health is wealth! This program includes self-guided coaching and journeys, cash incentives and discounts on your medical premiums through engaging in fun activities!
Gratitude is Green. We offer competitive pay across the organization, because, well… money matters!
In-House Gym. We want our employees to be the best versions of themselves. So come early, take a break in your day or finish strong with a workout!
Give Us a Reason (or not), and We’ll Celebrate. Regardless of whether there is a holiday or not, we are finding ways to kick back and enjoy each other’s company outside of day-to-day work.
Smart-Casual Dress. Come dressed in jeans (you’ll fit right in with the rest of us).
Paid Time Off & Paid Holidays. Not just lip service: we work hard, to play hard.
Anything Else? Absolutely.
DriveTime Family of Brands is Great Place to Work Certified! And get this: 90% of our rockstar employees say they feel right at home here. We could spend a lot of time having you read about ALL our awards, but we’ll save time (and practice some humility) just naming a few others; Comparably Awards: Best Company for Diversity, Best Company Culture and Best Company Leadership, oh and don’t forget Phoenix Business Journal Healthiest Employers (okay, we’ll stop there)!
Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of our background and drug screening process. DriveTime is a drug-free, tobacco-free workplace and an Equal Opportunity Employer.

And when it comes to hiring, we don't just look for the right person for the job, we seek out the right person for DriveTime. Buckle up for plenty of opportunities to grow in a professional, fun, and high-energy environment!

Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Data Ventures, akin to a nimble startup incubated within Walmart is building the best-in-class suite of Data Products to deliver actionable, customer-centric insights and help merchants and suppliers make better business decisions on omni channel 360 performance.

As a senior data analyst, you will have a prominent technical role in providing strategic and analytical support for business intelligence activities. One of the key responsibilities of the analyst is to analyze clickstream data captured from Walmart customers' digital shopping experience to help build actionable insights and product features. You will also work closely with various product and data stakeholders across the enterprise to deliver outstanding business outcomes.

About Team:
Our team creates reusable technologies to help with customer acquisition, onboarding, and empowering merchants, while ensuring a seamless experience for both of these stakeholders. We also optimize tariffs and assortment in accordance with Walmart's Everyday Low Cost philosophy. We not only create affordability, but we also deliver customized experiences for customers across all channels - in-store, mobile app, and websites.

What you'll do:

Translate product requirements into concise analytical plans and analyze large scale clickstream data across different dimensions and attributes from various data sources.
Employ appropriate statistical techniques to develop analytical methodologies to address business requests.
Help create strategy for clickstream data assets including Data Management and Governance, Data Quality Standards, Accessibility, Storage and Scalability, etc.
Partner with data scientists and other teams including product management and engineering to understand their data needs and provide data-driven insights for informed decision making.
Effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through visualizations, presentations, and other storytelling methods.
Ensure data quality and accuracy by developing and implementing data management policies and procedures.
Leverage BI tools such as Looker, Tableau and Power BI to develop and maintain reports and dashboards entailing a comprehensive view of business performance.
Perform ad hoc analyses with accuracy and clarity to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business value.



What you'll bring:

Prior knowledge and experience in E-commerce analytics and clickstream data
Passion for problem-solving, analytical mindset with critical-thinking, and data skills.
Excellent documentation, verbal and written communication skills
Ability to write code in Python/R, or equivalent language for data and trend analysis.
Advance knowledge of MS Office, SQL, NoSQL, and cloud technologies like GCP Big Query.
Well-versed experience working with large datasets, adaptable and innovative at finding solutions, and telling stories backed by data.
In-depth knowledge of visualization tools, data modeling, data transformation, and data visualization.
Strong experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic business environment.
(Preferred) Familiarity with A/B testing methodology and solid foundation in statistics.



About Walmart Global Tech
Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.

Flexible, hybrid work:
We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.

Why UT Southwestern?

With over 75 years of excellence in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas, UT Southwestern is committed to excellence, innovation, teamwork, and compassion. At UT Southwestern, we invest in you with opportunities for career growth and development that align with your future goals and help to provide security for you and your family. Our highly competitive benefits package offers healthcare, PTO and paid holidays, on-site childcare, wage, merit increases and so much more that are all available on the day you start work.

UT Southwestern is honored to be a Veteran Friendly work environment that is home to approximately 800 veterans. We value your integrity, dedication, and the commitment you’ve made to our country. We’re proud to support your next mission.

Ranked by Forbes as one of the Top 10 National Employers, we invite you to be a part of the UT Southwestern team where you’ll discover teamwork, professionalism, and consistent opportunities for growth.
Job Summary

UT Southwestern is hiring a Senior Data Analyst to work collaboratively within our Office for Institutional Opportunity and Information Resources (IR) team. As a steward of important organizational data, you will play an important role in analyzing data, identifying trends, and communicating results. The Data Analyst will develop and support new and existing internal and external requests for UT Southwestern and will play a key role in helping track the university's key performance metrics. We are looking for a data analyst with business intelligence skills who is familiar with healthcare data collection and can effectively communicate the department's efforts across UTSW. As the Data Analyst, you will use various visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, SQL) to report progress and identify opportunities for process improvements.
Experience and Education

Bachelor's degree in Science, Information Management, Healthcare Information, Statistics, Business or closely related field and five (5) years data management/analyst experience.

Work in a clinical or healthcare related field preferred. Master's Degree preferred.

Familiarity with scientific terms (in biology, biochemistry, chemistry, etc.) preferred.
Job Duties

Primary data steward responsible for all department databases, source systems and data structures. Responsible for the abstraction of data, analysis of data, and subsequent interpretation of data/ recommendations for consideration by departmental leadership, technical counterparts, and all relevant institutional business users.
Ensure accuracy of data and reporting across department functions, mitigating against any audit/data risk by setting processes to validate data an on ongoing basis.
Manages departmental projects and serves as primary departmental contact for all reporting/data mining tasks. Defines and maintains project plan and schedules.
Monitors compliance with definitions of project scope, timelines, and deliverables.
Provides regular project status reports to departmental leadership. Assists Department Data Analysts of lower status with data needs and project coordination. Serves as technical lead and subject matter expert (SME) for all source data systems relevant to department operations. Shares information with department management team on a recurring or as needed basis.
Serves as lead technical contact for relevant data points and sources systems for institutional projects/platforms (i.e. EDW, Organizational Dashboards, etc.)
Coordinates the data preparation and submission of documents to federal agencies, state agencies, private research funding agencies and other organizations as required by law and contractual vehicle.
Responsible for data mapping/data architecture across department data fields and relevant source systems, utilizing process maps and Business Intelligence architecture tools.
Leads development of education/training tools that educate team members and institutional partners on generation and/or interpretation of data, statistical analysis and application to decision making to improve organization efficiency and outcomes.
Performs other duties as assigned.

This position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code §51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information. English (US) THE ROLE AND THE COMPANY

Heidelberg Materials provides the materials to build our future. Our future is sustainable. Our future is digital. And it goes way beyond cement, aggregates and ready-mixed concrete. Heidelberg Materials North America, previously known as Lehigh Hanson, operates more than 450 locations with approximately 9,000 employees in the U.S. and Canada.

We are seeking a qualified Strategy and Development Analyst for its Irving (Las Colinas), TX location. The position of Strategy and Development Analyst will be responsible for developing a wide variety of analyses and documents that will be used by the senior management of Heidelberg Materials and the Strategy and Development team. The candidate will also support the Competence Center Logistics for 20% of their time. The candidate must be able to build positive working relationships with managers and employees throughout the Company and to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. The candidate must have a strong working knowledge of market research, financial statements, and strategic planning.

What You’ll Get to Do

Prepare comprehensive analyses of the economic, demographic, and competitive landscapes of current and potential markets as well as financial projection of businesses and projects.
Aid in assessing financial and strategic attractiveness and pursuing attractive opportunities, including organic growth projects as well as joint ventures, swaps, divestitures, mergers, and acquisitions.
Convert information and analyses into actionable decision frameworks and summary presentations for senior management.
Assist in creating strategies and plans to drive revenue growth, value enhancement and cost optimization.
Support the Strategy and Development Department with all aspects of strategic development job duties.

BA/BS degree with a major or focus in finance, business, economics, quantitative analysis, research or operations preferred.

Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Work well in a team and independently.
Proven ability to think creatively and strategically.
Demonstrated drive, initiative, and adaptability.
Excellent presentation skills and attention to detail.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office products, including Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Word.

Responsible for oversight and leadership of the Bank’s Analytics and Credit Scorecard Programs (‘Programs’) . Serves as a leader and ambassador of the Analytics group and assists with all aspects of the Programs, including developing repeatable, auditable, and sustainable processes; reporting and analysis to inform Executive Management and assist with first line credit risk management. Supports data, business, and forward-looking analytics for all programs, which includes capital and CRE stress testing, Credit Risk Scorecards, Current Expected Credit Losses (‘CECL’), portfolio analytics, market and economic analytics, etc. Directly manages staff and/or other managers with equivalent or less senior titles.


Essential Job Functions:

Leads and manages the development of sustainable, auditable, and repeatable processes to support Programs that enhance first-line credit risk management.
Managers and/or provides delivery of analytical support to Executive and first line management, as well as business units across the enterprise, with a focus on the commercial and consumer loan portfolios.
Leads and/or manages the development and implementation of a recurring schedule of analytics reporting on the Bank’s commercial and consumer loan portfolio using SAS, R, VBA, PL/SQL, PowerBI, and/or other tools.
Directly manages staff and managers within the Analytics team.
Collaborates on the development and implementation of strategic data initiatives that provide consistent and reliable access to data sources, reporting, and analytics across the enterprise.
Oversees analytics processes to extract and mine data to that support Bank initiatives, which may include capital and CRE stress testing, Current Expected Credit Losses, Credit Risk Scorecards, and/or other projects.
Executes and implements complex models in support of Analytics initiatives.
Leads meetings with stakeholders to assist with the conveyance of purpose, outline of expectations, and collaboration on the development of Programs.
Leads or manages development of analytics to assess market and economic risk.
Serves as the primary subject matter expert for the Analytics Department.
Develops framework, program, and process documentation for all Analytics activities.
Oversees the completion of all Analytics projects and ensures adherence to required timelines.
Communicates the status of projects to the the Managing Director and project stakeholders.
Provides the Board with updates on strategic and/or critical Analytics initiatives.
Develops and leads training to business unit managers and stakeholders.
Regularly exercises discretion and judgment in the performance of essential job functions.
Maintains good punctuality and attendance to work.
Follows Bank policy, procedure, and guidelines.
Performs other duties as may be required.


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Experience using analytical software such as SAS, SQL, R, Python, Power BI and/or Tableau.
Experience performing trend and root cause analyses.
Knowledge of modeling principles and processes, and data quality fundamentals and techniques.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to develop and execute queries and/or reporting for large data sets.
Ability to use critical thinking and creativity to solve business problems.
Ability to document procedures for execution of structured queries and reporting code.
Ability to operate and work collaboratively in a fast-paced, unpredictable environment, with exacting deadlines.
Ability to manage multiple work streams and deliverables, and coordinate across functional initiatives.
Ability to produce high-quality documents, presentations, and analyses.
Skill in using computer and Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

Computer
SQL, SAS, PowerBI, R, and similar tools
MS Office Applications, with a heavy reliance on Excel
Telephone

Data Analyst for our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program. This position will provide the technical component of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program in development, implementation, production monitoring and maintenance of our internal PrePay edits. Individual will work with our matrix partners to evaluate edit ideas and use business requirements to develop the technical processes to obtain desired results. Act as technical analyst for Proactive Claim Intervention projects and daily tasks for all aspects of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Data Analyst for the development, installation, execution and maintenance of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Develop and maintain editing on regular and ad-hoc basis, primarily using SAS, Microsoft SQL Server and internally developed ARM application.
Responsible for data mining activities and technology integration of Pre/PostPay Correction Program to support our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Evaluates and appropriately utilizes various approaches to data mining to narrow in on trends and drivers that directly impact outcomes.
Makes well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous IT architecture issues.
Participate in all phases of Pre/PostPay Edit program IT architecture process testing and implementation
Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency.
Works closely with matrix business partners to define data needs, opportunities for improvement and effectively communicates results of analysis and solutions.

Bachelor’s degree or higher strongly preferred in business, technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required.

Strong project management skills and comfort in ability to create and achieve success in highly matrixed environment.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to research, problem solve, trouble shoot, influence and partner across the organization to a drive toward resolution for the client, provider and organization.
Strong presentation skills. Able to prepare, deliver, and ensure understanding of information regarding any customer-related or process improvement topic across audiences.

We are Lockheed Martin



The Prognostics and Health Management
Advanced (PHM) Analytics Technical Lead is
responsible for providing technical and project
leadership for a team of data analysts and
engineers. The technical lead is responsible
for developing and maintaining; big data
infrastructure, data visualizations, advanced
methods, and job aids with team members and
through collaboration with internal and
external partners.
The technical lead is responsible for execution
and delivering on commitments and
maintaining relationships with customers and
partners with them and responds with agility to optimize diagnostics, prognostics, and data
analysis capabilities across Lockheed Martin
Aeronautics. They will produce and track key
performance indicators and utilize robust
project management techniques to achieve
cost and schedule constraints. They will
explain complex information confidently,
clearly, and succinctly to team members,
management and executives. The technical
lead owns high level PHM metrics and is
responsible for planning tasks and activities to
influence and drive PHM metrics.
The technical lead is responsible to help team
members overcome obstacles to completing
projects and accept responsibility for both
positive and negative team outcomes. They
mentor team members on elegantly leveraging
a combination of advanced methods in
innovative ways and help team members move
effectively and efficiently through changes by
facilitating. The technical lead will identify
innovative opportunities to share knowledge,
best practices and resources to drive efficiency
and foster collaboration.
The technical lead is responsible for the
technical solutions to unusually complex
technical problems. They will use proven and
sound statistical methods, to draw insights
from vast quantities of machine collected data
and aviation maintenance records and
translates those insights into capabilities that
optimize diagnostic and prognostic outcomes
for product end users and program decision
makers. They will demonstrate mastery at
identifying patterns from findings of various
research or disparate sets of solutions and
design concise algorithms and advanced
methods (machine learning, artificial
intelligence etc..) that automate key aspects of
unusually complex problems. They will use a
diverse set of software and database solutions.
They will have expertise in navigating complex
datasets and analyzing structured and
unstructured data to derive valuable insights
and anticipate issues and scenarios beyond
what is known when implementing solutions. The technical lead will develop and maintain PHM
Advanced Analytics strategy. They will build an
environment that facilitates the delivery of
discriminating, leading edge solutions to
address complex challenges and help shape
the future or PHM analytics, diagnostics, and
prognostics. They will develop and maintain
road maps for new techniques and work with
other technology leads in Lockheed Martin to
ensure data reporting, advanced methods, and
quality standards are progressing and meeting
PHM current and future needs. They will
advise and consult with leadership on
applications for advanced methods and
research.

Overview:
CiraConnect provides world-class cloud-based software and on-demand “back-office” shared services (SaaS) for self-managed community associations, professional community association management companies and residential real estate developers servicing the needs of homeowner associations (HOAs), condominium associations, cooperatives, luxury high-rises, municipal utility districts and large master planned communities. CiraConnect maintains an in-house software development team that places a premium on integrated software solutions and business process automation as tools to enable our employees to better service our clients and increase their job satisfaction.
Responsibilities:
Keep track of all payments and expenditures, including payroll, purchase orders, invoices, statements, etc.
Reconcile processed work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances.
Maintaining historical records
Paying employees by verifying expense reports
Paying vendors by scheduling pay checks and ensuring payment is received for outstanding credit; generally responding to all vendor enquiries regarding finance.
Preparing analyses of accounts and producing monthly reports
Continuing to improve the payment process.
Upload and entry of invoices in a high-volume work environment.
Communicate professionally with vendors and internal staff regarding billing and payment inquiries.
Plus, other work-related tasks as needed.
Qualifications:

Qualifications for the position include:

5-10 Years Accounts Payable experience (preferably full-cycle) or accounting experience.
Degree preferred.
Bank Reconciliation Experience
Experience working with generally accepted accounting principles and accounting software.
Knowledge of internal control systems and concepts.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Good planning and organizational skills to balance and prioritize work.
Ability to meet strict deadlines with minimal supervision.
Ability to use professional judgment and problem solving skills to make reasonable decisions and recommendations.
Ability to exhibit patience while working under stress and pressure.
Ability to take initiative and be a self-starter.
Ability to be a forward thinker and generate ideas and suggestions for process improvement.
Ability to critically analyze data and work processes.


Pay and Benefits:

Citibank, N.A. seeks an Applications Development Technical Lead Analyst for its Irving, Texas location.

Duties: Develop software solutions and review business requirements. Create business requirements document (BRD), and functional and non-functional requirements documents (FRD) to be shared with developers. Perform requirement gathering of the EAP datalake data ingestion, MapR Hadoop extraction and transformation requirements. Review architecture and provide suggestions for improvement based on requirements. Oversee onboarding of technology and architecture throughout the lifecycle of requirements, build, test, release, and post implementation support. Perform solution scoping and finalize the architecture best suitable for the project. Perform impact analysis on the system and validate the current architecture and future architecture. Evaluate the architecture to ensure latest processes, technology and tools are adapted to achieve project requirements. Perform application development and support. Oversee all development tasks and production release cycles, leveraging Agile and Waterfall methodologies. Prioritize requests for application enhancements and new development across the business portfolio. Analyze data using various Hadoop eco system tools including Beeline Hive client, Drill, Pig, Map reduce programs and ETL Tool Ab-Initio. Develop integration routines utilizing Ab initio, Spark and Hadoop technologies as per project technical documentation. Conduct unit testing post development of each application and review of Sprint and Unified testing practices. Create automation scripts to reduce manual effort and errors and increase efficiency using Unix Shell Scripting and Python. Conduct data analysis, data cleansing, data preparation and exploration by applying statistical knowledge and SQL skills on various databases including Oracle, Teradata and SQL. Perform application support and monitoring using Autosys and Control M. Conduct Incident logs analysis. Ensure the functional readiness of applications and processes. Design, develop and administer a series of tests and evaluations that will identify any potential issues with the product and application before it is released. Prepare testing scenarios, requirement traceability matrix and testing frameworks, review test cases and ensure zero defect leakage through Manual testing techniques. Perform Root cause analysis of the issues and tracing end-to-end flow. Perform gap analysis between source and target systems. Troubleshoot issues with applications using tools including UnRavel Data, Spark history UI, audit logs and execute the workflow procedures for production fixes. Coordinate with customers and vendors to define work programs and budgets, project management, and ensuring quality of work products. Perform change request management. A telecommuting/hybrid work schedule may be permitted within a commutable distance from the worksite, in accordance with Citi policies and protocols.

Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree or its foreign equivalent in Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related field and 5 years of progressively responsible, post-baccalaureate experience as an Applications Consultant, Assistant Consultant, Applications Development Team Lead, Programmer Analyst, or related position involving Ab Initio and ETL standards and architecture. 5 years of experience must include: Ab initio; Unix Shell Scripting, Python; Agile and Waterfall methodologies; Beeline Hive client; and SQL, Teradata, Oracle, Autosys, Control M. 3 years of experience must include: Spark, Hadoop, Drill, Pig, and Map reduce programs. Applicants submit resumes at https://jobs.citi.com/ or by email to Citigroup Recruiting Dept. at NAMobilityRecruitment@citi.com. Please reference Job ID #23706601. EO Employer.

Wage Range: $153,000 to $178,190

The GIS Analyst will analyze data, interpret client needs, find the information that addresses those needs, and present the data in the best format possible. The individual in this position compiles, manipulates, and analyzes geospatial data, and will contribute to business development, positioning and strategic planning that differentiates Stream. This individual will strive to enhance Stream’s offerings in the areas of data visualization, business intelligence, and other insightful outputs and is responsible for producing and presenting data visualizations in a compelling way to help drive strategy and support the real estate decision-making process.

We are looking for an incredibly talented person to produce a variety of high-quality geographic and demographic materials, leveraging ESRI products, fundamental GIS concepts, practices and procedures proficiently to accomplish analytical work.

This role will report to the National Director of Pursuits, on Stream’s National Marketing team, while partnering with local market leaders and partners and can office in any of our Stream locations.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Produces interactive maps, dashboards, reports, and presentations that brings data to life.
Integrates proprietary and subscription-based research data into engaging visualizations for the purposes of business development, external distribution, and client-based products.
Responds to internal stakeholder and external client requests for data and information.
Proactively searches for new and different data sources that elevates insights.
Educates internal and external clients about GIS capabilities and resources.
Mines and extracts data from the variety of sources, and data engineering.
Customizes interface of ESRI apps and story maps using ArcGIS Online Assistant.
Research new approaches to address geospatial data development challenges.
Seeks end-user/customer input regarding additional geographic services and enhancements to existing services and processes.
Develops, shares and stores best practices.
Familiarity with Model Builder, Python Scripting and Machine Learning, open-source platforms like CARTO, and Mapbox a plus.

Qualifications
BS/BA in geography, GIS, urban planning, economics, or relevant experience.
Strong working knowledge of the Esri platform: ArcMap/ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online, and ArcGIS Applications as well as other data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau).
3 - 5 years of experience preferred, but not required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Organizational and analytical skills.
Customer service centric.
Acute problem-solving skills.
Intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.
The ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Commercial real estate experience preferred.
Experience managing workload, ability to multi-task, succeed under pressure and effectively manage time.

Additional Information

Stream Realty Partners offers competitive salaries, annual bonuses, medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with company matching, pharmacy benefits, flexible spending accounts, health savings account, vacation pay, volunteer & community involvement paid time off, and holiday pay.

All information is held in compliance with EEOC guidelines. Stream is an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, veteran and/or military status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local laws. Global Risk and Security (GR&S) at Vanguard enables business strategy, protects client and Vanguard interests (e.g., assets and data), and stewards a strong risk culture. Our teams leverage enterprise-wide insights, deep expertise, and trusted advice so that across Vanguard leaders and crew drive faster, stronger, risk-informed decisions.

Within GR&S, the Enterprise Security and Fraud (ES&F) sub-division is responsible for the global protection of Vanguard crew, property, data, and client assets. We are the trusted advisors that protect the pride of Vanguard with state-of-the-art security and fraud capabilities. We are a world-class destination of highly-engaged, passionate, and diverse talent expected to continuously learn and develop in an ever-changing security landscape.

In this role, you will:

Contribute to the policy creation for various facets of DLP at Vanguard.
Lead, develop, manage, maintain and enhance security controls (alerts, rules, policies, and signatures) for the security platforms.
Conduct threat modeling exercises by leveraging threat intelligence frameworks. Orchestrate threat hunts in coordination with department and divisional partners to determine gaps in existing security controls.
Ensure proper defense depth design, configurations, and best practice for preventive solutions pertaining to the network environment for new and evolving cyber threats. Identify malicious activity by performing analysis on logs, traffic flows, and other investigative detective activities.
Provide support on tool and vendor assessments for Vanguard's DLP needs.
Provide written assessments focused on threats, vulnerabilities, and technologies relevant to Vanguard Infrastructure.
Lead with IT and business teams to ensure prompt and effective distribution of findings so incidents are addressed in the most effective and efficient manner possible. Provide department support to the business on enterprise wide security initiatives and projects.
Mentor junior team members to improve their technical acumen.


What it takes:

Minimum of eight years related work experience. 5 years of data security/data protection experience preferred.
Experience with data classification for cloud, email, network, and endpoint preferred.
Experience configuring policy and regular expressions preferred.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience required. Graduate degree preferred.
Preferred CISSP within one year of hire.

Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is offering visa sponsorship for this position.
