BASIC PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF POSITION
The SAP Analyst (MDG) role will primarily be responsible for suporting the MDG functionality of S/4HANA and partnering with the business to understand their requirements, ensure process standardization by utilizing out-of-the box SAP software capabilities, integration, hands on systems configuration, testing and operational monitoring to continuously improve efficiency and quality of the process.
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES: This position does the following in accordance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws / regulations and the Company’s policies, procedures and guidelines:

Support the Functional Consultant during business process discussions by means of interviews, workflow analyses and facilitated discussions with users.
Translates users' business requirements into detailed functional designs for development, testing and implementation.
Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements and specifications. Participates in and contributes to managing the scope of applications and related changes.
Identifies and communicates risks and issues impacting business rules, functional requirements and specifications. Participates in and contributes to managing the scope of applications and related changes.
Participate in UAT phase and go-live period of the MDG Implementation project to troubleshoot the issues in live system by engaging appropriate internal and external stakeholders, being responsive, leading the root cause analysis and thoughtful on upstream and downstream impacts of the change.
Assists quality assurance with functional test case reviews. Creates training materials and may assist with user training.
Drive continuous process improvements by monitoring and analyzing the KPIs, proposing process and system changes, providing the details on scope, estimate the cost of implementation, timelines, improve quality and the business outcomes
Other duties as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Information Sciences/Technology, Supply Chain or related fields required.
5 years of experience in Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment of SAP MDG.
At least 1 implementation / roll out experience in S4 HANA MDG implementation.
Strong understanding of the MDG functional processes around Data model, UI, BRFs, Workflow enhancements objects for various master data elements like business partner (Customer/vendor), Material master, and Financial Master.
Well versed in master data governance and management principles and best practices.
Strong understanding of the Order to Cash, Finance, Close to Disclose, and Procure to Pay processes and workflows within SAP.
Knowledgeable with SAP Customer and Material Master data domains.
Experience developing and communicating MDG standards and MDM solutions across different business entities and functions.
Expertise with SAP MDG configurations for Data modeling, UI modeling, process modeling, rules and derivations, BRF+, replication configurations.
Experience with S4 HANA and a good understanding of SD, MM, PM, and BP processes.
Understanding of the Data migration process of any master objects.
Technical knowledge of MDG workflows and SAP tables.
Knowledge of BRF+, Workflow, FPM, WebDynpro, Enhancements, IDOC’s and Proxies.
Experience of various data modeling techniques be an added advantage.
Good analytical and Communication skills.
Ability to lead small teams and coordinate with different stakeholders to resolve issues or problems.
Experience working in equipment distribution and/or manufacturing industry preferred.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Typical office environment.

We are recruiting for a Principal IT Disaster Recovery Analyst to join our team in Dallas, TX or Miramar, FL in a contract to hire role. Candidate must be in or willing to relocate to Dallas, TX, or Miramar, FL when hired on full-time as the position will become hybrid. The position focuses on enabling the IT Disaster Recovery process and providing expertise in D/R concepts, plan authoring, validation and testing of critical systems. The role is highly focused on the development, delivery and maintenance of technical and complex Ransomware planning and the support of simulation tests and tabletop exercises.

Responsibilities

· Coordinates with various information technology and business groups to identify critical systems and dependencies, and the potential vulnerabilities and risks that could result in catastrophic impact.

· Coordinates and executes Ransomware Rebuild simulation tests, documents results recovery time capabilities, issues, and resolutions through post-testing analysis.

· Serves as tertiary back-up during tabletop exercises or actual catastrophic disaster recovery or business continuity events.

· Gather and analyze data. Interpret gathered data.

· Submit reports to the relevant department heads and management

· Formulate procedural manuals if required

· Collaborates with business and IT stakeholders to identify, analyze, understand and prioritize activities by business value and urgency.

· Develops consultative partnerships with internal teams and leaders to understand their strategic objectives, key performance indicators and reporting requirements.

· Supports communications, meetings, and other collaborations as appropriate to effectively perform work and to understand, resolve, and/or mitigate risks, issues, obstacles, and conflicts

· Collaborate cross-functionally to enhance overall delivery of reporting across the business units and within the department.

· Establish and collect KPI to measure business value delivered by projects and solutions.

· Present to leadership recommendations on opportunities

· Lead the education and training of end users, working to increase end user proficiency and adoption of implemented solutions

· Understand, communicate and reinforce standard process concepts and methodology within the ETP organization

· Develop opportunities to automate ETP processes and functions

· Communicate systems and procedural changes to end users through excellent written and oral communications

· Monitor, coordinate metrics and act on exceptions to address issue

Requirements:

· Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or equivalent work experience

· Strong understanding of Ransomware recovery and architecture of Isolated Recovery Environments

· Subject matter expertise in IT Disaster Recovery with a minimum of 3 years of Disaster Recovery experience

· 3+ years of experience with developing / testing recovering strategies for cloud (IaaS / SaaS) based applications

· 3 + years of experience with automation and orchestration tools for recovering applications at alternate locations

· Working knowledge of recovery tools such as SRM and Zerto

· Strong project manager skills with 5+ years of hands on experience

· Experience developing business impact analysis documents

· Strategic mindset to lead recovery strategy planning efforts

· Demonstrated ability to coordinate complex integrated disaster recovery exercises

· Thorough knowledge of data management in order to assist in the preparation of recovery procedures

· Experience with Office 365, Teams and SharePoint

· Strong Visio, technical writing, and project management skills

· Can analyze an issue and troubleshoot

· Responsible for mentorship of junior team members

· Proficient change management skills

· Preferred ITIL v3 foundation certification

· Experience in Support and Incident, Problem, Event and Change Management

· Understanding of data center operations and the interaction between the teams that support the systems and network Infrastructure

· Exposure with Enterprise Monitoring tools, Microsoft SCOM, SolarWInds, SquaredUP, Automated Escalation software.

· Exposure to Incident Command System (ICS) / National Incident Management System (NIMS) concepts with special focus on Incident Commander responsibilities

· A mix of Infrastructure skills across server, database, network and support desk

· Thorough understanding of data center operations and the interaction between the teams that support the systems and network Infrastructure

· Expertise in problem management, root cause analysis methodologies and incident resolution

· Experience with APM (Application Performance Monitoring) and other Monitoring Solution tools.

· Experience in an Operations Control Center

Position Summary:




Under general supervision, in alignment with the TRWD Geospatial Services department vision, utilize standard survey and Geographic Information Systems (GIS) concepts and technology to contribute to TRWD’s Enterprise GIS and survey support system, supporting all TRWD departments, functions, and mission. Perform and develop survey and GIS concepts, principles, analysis, and solutions to quickly solve multifaceted spatial problems.




Essential Functions and Responsibilities:




Utilize Trimble survey and total station equipment to collect, locate and transmit collected data into TRWD’s Enterprise GIS database as well as utilize specialized equipment (such as an electronic location tool or a remote-controlled catamaran) for surveying, locating, mapping, data collection and processing
Utilize advanced surveying techniques and equipment to set control, calibrate to local control, and traverse
Locate and stake TRWD property boundaries per legal description and plat
Utilize Esri desktop and/or web GIS software to visualize, manipulate, display, create, edit, and analyze data stored in the TRWD Enterprise GIS, and ensure GIS/GPS data is accurate, useable, and current
Familiarity with working within a multi-user GIS environment. Understanding of versioning and basic database management and maintenance routines
Maintain proper documentation of geospatial concepts such as map and database layers (including metadata), data processing tasks, as well as surveying techniques and concepts
Create, publish, and configure map and feature services utilizing Esri web GIS products
Responsible for providing GIS and GPS assistance and project support to TRWD GIS users and non-GIS users, including troubleshooting software-related issues and\or performing complex spatial analysis of geographic data on their behalf
Assists with training and development of other GIS technical staff, and develops training materials as needed
Understand and utilize linear referencing concepts
Participate in the development and testing of desktop/field GIS applications
Resolve TRWD staff GIS and survey user technical issues as directed
Capable of interpreting Plan & Profile drawings, As-Built drawings, Operations and Maintenance Manuals, and other Engineering related documents
Conduct CAD data conversion, CAD data inventory, and other activities as directed
Perform administrative duties such as copying, scanning, and typing
File and organize data and equipment within the department
Maintain familiarity with strategic TRWD levels of service
Continuous improvement monitoring and innovation efforts
Perform other duties as required



Required Experience:




Two (2) years of increasing technical experience in survey concepts
Two (2) years of experience with Trimble and Esri software products/solutions



Desired Experience:




Proficient in the use of Trimble survey equipment and software, and the implementation of that data into GIS
Proficient in the use of Esri software



Required Education/Certification/License:




Bachelor’s degree in GIS, Geography, Survey (Geomatics), or related discipline; or Associate’s degree in GIS, Survey, or related discipline with 2 years of additional GIS/survey/geospatial experience
Valid Texas driver’s license



Desired Education/Certification/License:




Certification(s) in GIS or Survey



Success Factors/Job Competencies:




Successful applicant will have a good knowledge of and be self-sufficient with analysis processes utilizing Trimble equipment/software and Esri software, and have good analytical, problem solving, and communication skills
Have an aptitude for brainstorming, troubleshooting, and problem solving
The ability to assess stakeholder needs, identify issues and opportunities, analyze problems, and assess alternative solutions, develop sound conclusions and recommendations, prioritize, and carry out assigned projects to meet needs most effectively in a timely manner
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with managers, co-workers, representatives of other departments and divisions, and professionals in other public agencies
Self-starter, strong work ethic with attention to detail in the quality control and assurance of their work
Ability to complete all tasks assigned by given deadlines
Positive attitude with a team orientated focus
May require working long or unusual hours



Physical Demands and Work Environment:




The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Physical demands: While performing duties of job, employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hand to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; balance; stoop; talk and hear. Employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 80 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Employee will be expected to perform some these duties in the field and on construction sites.
Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee typically resides within an office or cubicle or out in the field for long periods of time exposing the employee to weather conditions prevalent at the time. They will periodically work in buildings without climate control. This position will also work in confined spaces, underground, in diches, on water ways such as lakes or rivers, and at various heights.
Equipment Use: Trimble surveying equipment & software, Esri software, personal computer, printer, plotter, calculator, specialized equipment (survey instruments, GPS devices, laser range finder, etc…).



(HR Use Only: Pos # 116)

Senior Pricing Analyst

The Senior Pricing Analyst is primarily responsible for program performance analysis and pricing activities within the Global trade-in programs. The Pricing Analyst will have the opportunity to 1) gather, organize, and analyze business data; 2) make significant contributions in assuring deliverables meet the plan and; 3) actively participate in the pricing process for setting trade-in values, asset recovery, and disposition.

This position will be focused on working with large and complex datasets while translating business questions into data-driven insights. Power BI will be used as a data visualization tool to create executive dashboards to track program performance. Curiosity and creativity are key to developing new solutions to tough business questions asked of this role and team.

The analyst utilizes formal training and/or a high level of first-hand experience to analyze and evaluate existing or proposed procedures and revise or develop process controls, systems, and related procedures to process and analyze data. The analyst will be focused on pricing-related activities to provide efficient solutions to drive data-driven decisions across the broader team.

What will my duties and responsibilities be in this job?

Develop solutions and recommendations for improving pricing decisions through applying in-depth business understanding.

Responsible for querying large data sets and transforming data into digestible intelligence for diverse audiences.

Assist in the early stages of requirements analysis and development activities.

Participate in the development of reporting solutions according to business and technical requirements.

Apply market understanding and data to improve information and models used to drive pricing decision processes.

Document existing and new business workflows with applicable metrics and measures

Identify defective or ineffective work processes/flows within related work areas and make appropriate recommendations for improvement, efficiency gains, or optimization.

Perform analysis on the impact of new launches against existing devices on the collection plan

Closely coordinate activities with internal cross-functional teams in order to optimize asset value management processes and asset recovery programs.

Analyze factors in the marketplace and those impacting the program to formulate forecasts, estimates, and projections that impact selling initiatives.

Perform other related tasks or duties as required or assigned

What are the requirements needed for this position?

Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain, statistics or similar

A minimum of 5 years of experience in a Pricing function or a related field such as data analytics or financial modeling

Experience implementing and managing pricing strategy

Ability to track and monitor market pricing

Experience creating financial models and program analysis to drive program profitability

Skills, interest, and curiosity to derive insight from large amounts of data from diverse sources

Excellent communication to be able to articulate data and findings to management

What other skills/experiences would be helpful to have?

Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively perform system support duties

Ability to quickly learn new applications

Ability to process time-sensitive data and information from multiple sources, make decisions, and communicate actions

Ability to prioritize, organize, and work independently, or as part of a project team, to complete multiple tasks

Requires the ability to perform detailed work

Requires strong interpersonal skills

Working knowledge of wireless handsets

How much should I expect to travel? 5%

Description:

Company Overview:

We are looking for a roll-up-your-sleeves and do-what-it-takes mentality for this

position. Southern Champion is a fun, family-owned alcohol beverage company in

Carrollton, Texas. Great benefits in a fast-growing company.

As Sales Operations Analyst, you will ensure the company’s supply meets the customers’ demand. Your duties

include overseeing the company’s supply chains, ensuring timely delivery and keeping the company on

budget.

Requirements:
Sales Operations Analysts improve the efficiency of supply chain operations through data collection and
analysis. Utilize interpersonal and problem-solving skills to gather information from different departments and external sources to recommend ways of improving the supply chain to our customers.
Specific Sales Operations Analyst duties:
Collect data on sales operations as it relates to sales order demand.
Identify and assess customers’ needs to achieve satisfaction.
Keep records of customer interactions, process customer accounts and file documents
Analyze data to identify areas of sales operations to improve efficiency.
Develop and execute projects to enhance supply chain operations.
Build sustainable business relationships and trust with Distributor Buyers through open and interactive communication.
Establish and maintain internal professional relationships with Logistics and Sales teams.
Assess distributor operations and enforce compliance with order standards.
Provide accurate, valid, and complete information by using the correct methods/tools.
Follow communication procedures, guidelines, and policies.
Measure sales operations performance and report to management.
Other duties as assigned.
Must have 2 years of experience.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent.

Overview:
Now is the time to join us and make a difference. Be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives. Here at the American Heart Association, you matter and so does your career.

The American Heart Association has an excellent opportunity for an Application Analyst in our National Center office located in Dallas, TX.

As the application analyst you will be responsible for technical management and administration of American Heart Association’s service applications and their integrations with Healthcare Business Solutions (HBS) ecosystem of webapps and external customer or vendor systems as needed. Responsible for data analysis, troubleshooting, training, and documenting best practices. Capable of performing in a Level 2 support role. Also, responsible for building and managing relationship(s) with application owners, support vendors and other American Heart Association departments to provide and receive support as needed.


The Association offers many resources to help you maintain work-life harmonization through your changing needs and life situations. To help you be successful, you will have access to Heart U, our award-winning corporate university, as well as additional training and support, locally.


#TheAHALife is our company culture, our way of life, reflecting our diversity, equity & inclusion, our focus on work-life harmonization and our Guiding Values. Discover why you will Be Seen. Be Heard. Be Valued™ at the American Heart Association by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, X (formerly Twitter), and at heart.org.

Responsibilities:
Provides analysis and administration and support of the HBS ecosystem of service applications (eCards, CE/Credentialing, American Heart Association Data Hub), including site testing, administrative setup, product rollouts, security, workflow, schedules and maintenance, training, and configuration. Will also need to understand the various integration points and fulfillment platforms that contribute to the customer facing webapps in the HBS ecosystem and be able to handle and prioritize related issues with the respective vendor/owner.
Provides Level 2 service and support through various channels (such as email, ticketing systems or other web-based communications) .
Plans, coordinates, and organizes application modification projects, which includes capturing business requirements, identifying resources, and participating in scheduling and implementation.
Troubleshoots and conducts technical analysis to resolve problems within the service app ecosystem and its various integration points.
Conducts quality assurance and testing during upgrade releases and ensures the American Heart Association customization remains intact. Identifies and resolves issues with new code or releases.
Identifies and documents assigned application standard processes. Analyzes data and reports to ensure application data quality. Can also present and communicate reports to all levels of the organization as well as internal and external partners.
Leads Power User Group to ensure business understanding and user alignment with best practices and standards. Provides training to users and lower-level system administrators.
Advances issues and concerns to management, application vendor or developer(s) to resolve.


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in information systems, Computer Science, eCommerce applications or equivalent work experience
Three (3) years of experience with business application support, management and administration
Comprehensive understanding and knowledge of technology and languages behind
assigned application including but not limited to CSS, HTML, JavaScript, XML, REST
APIs or other programming languages as required by application assignment.
Ability to train and mentor application users with sophisticated customer.
service skills
Excellent facilitation and interpersonal skills. Proactively get in touch with staff,
Volunteers, vendors and customers to share information, knowledge, expertise, and
time to achieve common goals, update on progress and issues
Excellent organizational skills
Preferred Qualifications
Training and instruction
Experience working with customer in a consultative manner
Experience with eCommerce platforms


Compensation & Benefits:

The American Heart Association invests in its people. Here are the main components of our total rewards package. Visit Rewards & Benefits to see more details.


Compensation – Our goal is to ensure you have a competitive base salary. That’s why we regularly review the market value of jobs and make adjustments, as needed.

Performance and Recognition – You are rewarded for achieving success by merit increases and incentive programs, based on the type of position.

Benefits – We offer a wide array of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, along with a robust retirement program that includes an employer match and automatic contribution. As a mark of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer an employee assistance program, employee wellness program and telemedicine, and medical consultation.

Professional Development – You can join one of our many Employee Resource Groups (ERG) or be a mentor/mentee in our professional mentoring program. HeartU is the Association’s national online university, with more than 100,000 resources designed to meet your needs and busy schedule.

Work-Life Harmonization – The Association offers Paid Time Off (PTO) at a minimum of 16 days per year for new employees. The number of days will increase based on seniority level. You will also have a total of 12 paid holidays off each year, which includes several days off at the end of the year.

Tuition Assistance - We support the career development of all employees. This program provides financial assistance to employees who wish to further their education and career in relation to their current duties and responsibilities, or for potential future positions in the organization.
:

The American Heart Association’s 2024 Goal: Every person deserves the opportunity for a full, healthy life. As champions for health equity, by 2024, the American Heart Association will advance cardiovascular health for all, including identifying and removing barriers to health care access and quality.

At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, our mission is to be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, religion, age, language, sexual orientation, national origin and physical or cognitive abilities. We're committed to ensuring our workforce, workplace culture and mission have a shared impact across a diverse set of backgrounds.

Responsibilities:

Who We Are:

SiriusXM and its brands (Pandora, Stitcher, SXM Media, AdsWizz, Simplecast, and SiriusXM Connected Vehicle Services) are leading a new era of audio entertainment and services by delivering the most compelling subscription and ad-supported audio entertainment experience for listeners - in the car, at home, and anywhere on the go with connected devices. Our vision is to shape the future of audio, where everyone can be effortlessly connected to the voices, stories and music they love wherever they are.

This is the place where a diverse group of emerging talent and legends alike come to share authentic and purposeful songs, stories, sounds and insights through some of the best programming and technology in the world. Our critically-acclaimed, industry-leading audio entertainment encompasses music, sports, comedy, news, talk, live events, and podcasting. No matter their individual role, each of our employees plays a vital part in bringing SiriusXM’s vision to life every day.

SiriusXM Connected Vehicle

SiriusXM Connected Vehicle (SiriusXM CV) is a leading provider of connected services to vehicle manufacturers, delivering one of the most broadly adopted connected vehicle platforms in North America for the last 25 years. Named the 2020 Company of the Year in the Telematics Industry by Frost & Sullivan, we provide safety, security and convenience services to millions of vehicle owners across major automotive brands. Our teams are continuously working to develop leading-edge technology that can not only add convenience to the daily lives of so many drivers across the country but our advancements in safety and security could also help save their lives.

How you’ll make an impact:

This position is responsible for owning the campaign quality and issue resolution for key marketing initiatives across the business that require systems support. This person would be the primary liaison between marketing, engineering, IT, and product teams for successful continuous improvement of marketing campaign development. The right person for this role will be able to oversee many complicated projects at once, provide effective solutions, lead with strong communication skills, and have acute attention to detail.

The role has a specific focus in initiatives that drive conversion and retention metrics owned by marketing. Functional areas include: billing/subscription system enhancements, marketing database development, call center/IVR/agent portal functionality, in-app push messaging, and customer onboarding web and app development. Understanding what is possible and working with the broader marketing organization to develop and prioritize impactful strategies is critical to success. As part of this dynamic and collaborative team, you will be instrumental in identifying areas of improvement and helping define and implement the solution(s).


What you’ll do:

Manage issue tracking and coordinate remediation of issues with development team.
Defect Analysis and Resolution
Oversee the end-to-end defect management process, ensuring the proper hand-offs and coordination between project teams.
Establish defect resolution metrics that quantify progress while highlighting potential areas for improvement.
Manage the prioritization of defects and queue workload for defect teams including identification of resource constraints.
Facilitate recurring conference calls to triage issues with the customer.
Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for campaign and analytics databases and processes
Identify and document defects, and work with cross-functional teams to resolve issues
Collaborate with business analysts, data analysts, and developers to ensure that requirements are properly translated into test plans and test cases
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can improve the quality marketing campaign data, segmentation, and reporting
Identify opportunities for process improvement and make recommendations to improve the efficiency and effectiveness marketing campaigns
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that data is accurate, complete, and timely
Ensure that data is properly transformed and loaded into database and downstream tools
Create test approach for data testing, including developing test scenarios, test cases, and test data
Use data testing tools to validate data quality and integrity

What you’ll need:

Bachelor's degree in marketing or business-related field or equivalent, relevant experience. MBA preferred.
Minimum of 5 years database and/or marketing database experience or equivalent industry experience.
Individual contributor
Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences as well have the ability understand issues from a Marketing and customer experience perspective.
Strong process orientation and expertise in documentation.
Excellent technical analysis, planning and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of the principles, practices, and procedures of user acceptance testing
Ability to independently analyze data, identify discrepancies and inconsistencies and recommend a course of corrective action
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, team–oriented work environment
Ability to work with minimal supervision and demonstrate initiative and good judgment
Interpersonal skills and ability to interact and work with staff at all levels
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
Commitment to “internal client” and customer service principles
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines
Must have legal right to work in the U.S.

Our goal at SiriusXM is to provide and maintain a work environment that fosters mutual respect, professionalism and cooperation. .

Pull all commission and client reports and organize data for the purpose of weekly commission imports. Will also analyze data to find discrepancies in sales reporting.

Organize all data, from multiple sources and look for congruency and errors
Analyze commission amounts paid to see if it is correct
Organize imports to go into internal commission system
Create and maintain details and records of all past and present transactions

Gather commission and sales reports from various insurance carrier’s sources
Organize all data, from multiple sources and look for congruency and errors

Identify and communicate process improvement opportunities within the department

Description

Brado is looking for an inquisitive BI Analyst who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing data. Do you have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large digital data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes? If you answered yes, we want to meet you!

Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.

Requirements
3+ Years of Python Experience
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: Python, SQL, etc.
Experience of Platforms: Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, Databricks, etc.
Experience using statistical computer languages (SQL, Python, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
The expertise to architect, develop and troubleshoot large production-grade distributed systems on GCP and select the appropriate tools to tackle business problems at the correct scale.
Experienced working with cloud data storage, data warehousing/data lake architecture, ELT/ ETL, and reporting/ analytic frameworks technologies, such as BigQuery, Dataflow, Looker Studio, and Tableau.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science, Mathematics, or Statistics. Relevant master’s degree strongly preferred.
Benefits
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home

Description/Comment:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes;
communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and
coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

* Review program engineering configuration control methodology and
variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and
provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or
system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and
maintained
* Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant
data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
* Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product
baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
* Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure
in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
* Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional
leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
* Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide
specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
* Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new
or changing requirements.
* Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell
and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and
suppliers).
* Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related
change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change
Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders
before, during and after the sessions.
* Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide
direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
* Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material
and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide
feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
* Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item
Deliverable (DID) requirements.
* Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable
information.
* Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system
migration.

Education and Experience:

* Bachelor's or 4-year degree is required
* Must have certification in configuration management
* Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data
management, administrative or office environment experience
* Familiarity with ENOVIA.
* Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software,
data management software, and document imaging software.
* Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms
Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated
markings.
* Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures
required to execute the change process, configuration management, data
management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
* Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods
contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.
* Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods
contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.

Summary
OCC is seeking an individual who would be responsible for discovering, synthesizing, and analyzing information from a variety of internal and external sources, including tools, processes, documentation, and stakeholders. The ideal candidate is a proven change agent that demonstrates the ability to solve complex problems through logical, digestible solutions that deliver key value to our stakeholders. Additionally, this individual must be comfortable communicating to all levels of the organization as well as inside and outside the organization. Skills that are foundational to the success of this role include, but are not limited to, communication, analytical, problem solving, process modelling, facilitation, elicitation, scope management, leadership and agile mindset.

Responsibilities
Act as a partner to both the business and the technology teams
Identify scope gaps and missing requirements by acquiring an in depth understanding of current state (i.e., legacy system) and future state
Identify product team dependencies and plan for resolution
Work cross-functionally to analyze and define key stakeholder business needs
Perform requirements analysis, story decomposition, system integration analysis, and data flow design
Regularly engage in agile activities including sprint planning and backlog grooming. Act as an advisor to the Product owner regarding next steps and approvals
Build high quality user stories and acceptance criteria; work with scrum team to refine user stories
Provide requirement and design support to scrum team

Job Title: Configuration and Data Management Analyst

Location:Dallas,TX

Duration: Full Time/Contract

Description/Comment:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes; communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

Review program engineering configuration control methodology and variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and maintained
Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new or changing requirements.
Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and suppliers).
Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders before, during and after the sessions.
Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item Deliverable (DID) requirements.
Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable information.
Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system migration.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or 4-year degree is required
Must have certification in configuration management
Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data management, administrative or office environment experience
Familiarity with ENOVIA.
Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software, data management software, and document imaging software.
Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated markings.
Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures required to execute the change process, configuration management, data management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.

Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Job Description

Business Analyst _ Headless CMS Expertise

Remote Job


Job Summary: The Headless CMS Business Analyst is responsible for understanding and translating business needs and requirements into effective solutions using headless content management systems (CMS). They work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that content management processes are efficient, scalable, and aligned with organizational goals. The role involves analyzing, documenting, and implementing CMS strategies and configurations to support content delivery across various channels and devices.


Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, information technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a business analyst in the context of headless CMS implementations.
Strong understanding of content management concepts and technologies.
Familiarity with various headless CMS platforms (e.g., Contentful, Strapi, Sanity, etc.).
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of content modeling, taxonomies, and content strategies is a plus.
Project management skills are beneficial.
The Headless CMS Business Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring that the organization's content management and delivery align with business goals and user expectations. This role requires a balance of technical expertise, business acumen, and communication skills to drive successful headless CMS implementations.

JOB TITLE: Loan Portfolio Risk Analyst

REPORTS TO: SVP, Credit Officer

TYPE: Entry level - In-office only.




GENERAL SUMMARY

Ciera Bank has been serving Texas Communities since 1890, and we now have 8 locations. We’re looking for a full-time Loan Portfolio Risk Analyst at our Fort Worth location. This is an in-office position. The Portfolio Analyst will play a crucial part in managing and optimizing our loan portfolio. They will handle data reporting, support cross-functional departments, and ensure the success of our financial operations.

We do offer a competitive hourly rate (based on experience) with a multitude of benefits and a generous PTO schedule. We’ll provide training and support to help you succeed in your role and provide you with opportunities to advance your career. At Ciera Bank, we consider our employees to be one of our most valuable resources.




COMPETITIVE BENEFITS:

Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
Flexible Spending Account
401(k) or ROTH with Company Match
Employer Paid Life/Disability/Dependent Life Insurance
PTO Benefits w/Paid Holidays
Incentive Award/Bonus Program
Monthly Gym Allowance
Tuition Reimbursement Program
Continuing Education/Training & Development Opportunities
Free Checking/Savings Accounts
Annual Company Apparel Allowance



ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS (of Loan Portfolio Risk Analyst)

Analyze and assess the bank's loan portfolio to identify trends, risks, and opportunities. This includes conducting credit risk analysis, delinquency reports, and stress testing.
Develop and maintain comprehensive reporting systems to track and report on key loan portfolio metrics, including loan performance, credit quality, and concentration risk.
Efficiently manage and organize data related to loans, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. This may involve working with databases and data management tools.
Conduct risk assessments and monitor loan performance to identify potential issues and propose strategies for risk mitigation.
Develop and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) for loan portfolio performance. Report on KPIs to senior management to support strategic decision-making.
Produce ad hoc reports and analyses as needed to respond to specific inquiries from management or regulatory authorities.
Ensure that all loan portfolio activities adhere to regulatory and compliance requirements. Stay updated on industry regulations and standards.



Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including credit analysts, finance, and compliance departments, to gather and analyze data for loan portfolio assessments.
Based on data analysis, provide recommendations and insights to support credit risk management and loan portfolio growth strategies.
Maintain accurate records of loan portfolio analyses and reports for audit purposes.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES (of Loan Portfolio Risk Analyst)

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Data Science, Data Analytics, Economics, or a related field.
Advanced data analytical skills with an ability to interpret complex financial information and identify relevant risk.
Professional experience in financial, credit, and/or statistical analysis, with experience in underwriting commercial loans is preferred.
In-depth knowledge of accounting principles with ability to prepare and analyze financial statements.
Knowledge of data analytics and report creation.
Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Word and Excel, with a strong emphasis on financial modeling.
Advanced written, oral, and interpersonal skills with ability to prepare and perform presentations.
Ability to work on multiple transactions simultaneously and prioritize assignments to meet deadlines.
Must be self-motivated with strong initiative, accountability, and attention to detail.



PHYSICAL DEMANDS (of Loan Portfolio Risk Analyst)

Work involves standing and walking for brief periods of time, but most duties are performed from a seated position. There is potential for eyestrain from reading detailed printouts and computer screens. Deadlines, workloads during peak periods and pressure may cause increased stress levels. Work may include occasional pushing, pulling, or carrying objects weighing up to 20 pounds such as files, documents, and computer printouts. Work normally requires finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination to operate the computer keyboard at an advanced skill level.




WORKING RELATIONSHIPS/CONTACTS (of Loan Portfolio Risk Analyst)

Internal – Any other bank employees, as necessary to fulfill job requirements.
External – Occasional contact with borrowers, auditors, regulators, etc.
Supervision of Others – No direct supervision of others.


#LI-Onsite

Overview:
Veritex Community Bank is looking for an experienced Business/Systems Analyst to partner with PMO and Veritex business partners across Commercial & Consumer Lending, Credit Cards, Special Assets, Credit, and Treasury. The Business/Systems Analyst will serve as a liaison between Veritex team members, Technology, and 3rd party vendors as they implement process improvements and operational efficiencies across the bank.

In this role, the Business/Systems Analyst will be asked to analyze data and processes, problem solve, document project related information (project charter, business requirements, process workflows, test cases, etc.). Project related responsibilities include but are not limited to discovery, issue tracking, change management, testing, and additional needs as they arise in support of project efforts.


To succeed in this role, applicants should be a strong team player, have excellent time management, and communication skills. Although there will be independent work, this role focuses on collaboration with internal and external partners to deliver results on deadlines. The Business/Systems Analyst will support projects from concept to delivery and post-implementation.
Responsibilities:
Transform business requests into actionable deliverables (project charter, business requirements, process maps, costs/benefits, etc.)
Conduct stakeholder interviews and requirement sessions to capture and refine business requirements and targeted analysis.
Plan, schedule and facilitate meetings with business owners & SMEs
Record & distribute detailed meeting minutes
Track and monitor risks, issues, actions, and decisions
Obtain, analyze, and synthesize information from multiple business users to help distinguish request from needs
Become a product and/or, process subject matter expert
Develop and execute test plans and scripts, lead testing such as user acceptance and system integration
Act as liaison between business and technical members of the project, if needed
Ensure adherence to internal practices and standards resulting in consistent development and implementation of project components
Provide training and support to end users
Qualifications:
Job Skills and Qualifications:
Proven ability to build rapport and maintain relationships with internal partners at all levels within the organization
Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills
Superior problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills required
5+ years of business/systems analyst experience required across one or more of the following project types: Business Process Reengineering, Strategy Transformation, Vendor Integration, SDLC projects
Proven work experience as a Business Analyst or Consultant from top tier management consulting, or similar role
Approaches work in a flexible, solution focused manner and is able to collaborate effectively with team members
Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision
Experience in data analysis, and general project management methods
Experience developing, leading, and executing test plans and scripts, including both user acceptance and system integration testing
An ability to prepare and interpret data, flowcharts, schedules and step-by-step action plans
Strong client-facing skills
Proficient use of MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Outlook, MS SharePoint and MS Visio
Hands-on experience with project management tools (e.g. Smartsheet, Visio, MS Project)
B.S. in Business Administration or related field
Assists in researching process and/or technical related incidents and issues, including conducting detailed root cause analysis to avoid further impacts and decrease the risk of recurring issues
Strong sense of urgency and ownership when resolving issues

Truth in Texas Banking. That’s what we’re about. Founded in 2010, we are one of the ten largest banks headquartered in the state of Texas. We became a publicly traded company in 2014 and in 2020 and 2021 we were listed on Fortune’s 100 Fastest Growing Companies. Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, we’ve built a bank forever rooted in truth, transparency, and uncompromising integrity.




We know our strongest asset is the passion, authenticity, and talent of our people. We focus on the growth and development of each team member to unlock potential to “Be Your True Self.” Our “True You” culture is made up of five pillars:




Be Mindful
Be Healthy

Be Prosperous
Be Faithful


With this as our foundation, we’ve built a bank of people who are transparent, tell the truth, and act with integrity. We unite together in common purpose - caring deeply for our clients and communities, communicating openly with each other, and treating everyone with respect. Visit our website at www.VeritexBank.com and come see how we’re bringing truth and transparency to Texas banking.

Company Overview:

If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!

Workday Reporting and HR Data Analytics Analyst

Flowserve is looking for a Workday Reporting and Data Analytics Analyst who will be part of a team tasked with balancing people, process, and technology to help enable HR make informed decisions and deliver results. The HR Data Reporting and Analytics team takes HR fundamentals and metrics and innovates to improve efficiencies, create data to support decisions, enable leadership effectiveness, and enhance the experience of our stakeholders. You’ll partner with stakeholders across the business to design and implement scalable HR analytics and define opportunities for improvement.

Requirements:

Experience aggregating and analyzing data spanning multiple sources and reporting tools

Experience developing and implementing new ideas and creative solutions for improved efficiency and effectiveness.

Working knowledge of business intelligence reporting tools (e.g., BI Tools like Power BI, QlikView, Tableau) and Data Management tools/platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure, SQL, etc.)

Strength in People/Data Analytics, Statistics and Data Science.

Experience participating in cross-functional, multi-geographic teams.

3-5+ years of experience in quantitative or process improvement roles, using data analytics, mining, and/or visualization to solve problems.

Proficiency in Excel (formulas, pivots, macros) and experience performing ad-hoc analysis

3-5 years of experience in Workday Reporting including experience with Prism, Discovery Boards, Worksheets and Slides

Knowledge and hands-on experience of Workday HCM and other Workday HR capabilities like Learning, Recruiting, Compensation, Payroll, etc.

Working knowledge of continuous improvement methodologies such as Lean Six-Sigma, DMAIC/Agile, or root-cause analysis a plus

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, or equivalent experience

Skills:

Strong business communication, presentation and writing skills.

Ability to communicate technical information and data to a non-technical audience in a logical, concise manner.

Strong problem formulation and creative problem-solving skills.

Superior learning agility; able to learn independently from a variety of sources; ability to thrive in ambiguous situations.

Collaboration skills to develop buy-in and consensus that drives progress and results.

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of management through diplomacy and tact.

Ability to handle multiple tasks and responsibilities.

Responsibilities:

Explore people data and evaluate trends to help develop core people metrics and identify opportunities to create meaningful, actionable insights and recommendations.

Effectively partner with cross-functional teams & business partners with intent to build strong relationships that ultimately lead to identification of ways the reporting and analytics team can engage and improve business value.

Ability to assess, capture, and translate complex business questions into metrics that can be evaluated to help measure the effectiveness of various HR work streams.

Analytical ability around data retrieval, manipulation, and performance analysis from data management systems; further turn this data into useful information

Champion data quality processes and consistent use and adoption of measures, hierarchies, tools and reporting standards.

Develop reporting to help measure effectiveness of HR initiatives using data from the core HR systems: Human Capital Management, Talent/Performance management, Learning Management, Recruiting/Applicant Tracking, and Employee Engagement

Preferred Experience:

Ability to leverage HR data to support business partnering conversations. Previous experience in coaching and driving change management programs.

Predictive modeling experience with employee retention, employee performance, and other relevant workforce function

Experience in working with manufacturing, engineering, or sales teams.

Ability to influence others on proposed courses of action, be firm but be diplomatic at the same time.

Ability to travel as needed.

Flowserve offers competitive pay, annual bonuses, medical benefits on day 1, generous paid vacation time, paid holidays, 401(k) and many other excellent benefits!

Overview:

The primary purpose and function of the Analyst, People Systems LMS is to design, develop and implement solutions to enhance performance. Lead and assist with configuration, integration, customization, and data management of the organizations Learning Management System (LMS). This individual will also develop custom reports, expand content capabilities, and work on special projects to meet client/stakeholder needs.

Responsibilities
Oversee day-to-day administration of the Cornerstone OnDemand Learning Management System. Which includes:
Answering Help Desk tickets for end user support.
Testing all software updates/enhancements to ensure continuity of system.
Maintain training catalogs.
Ensure training content is always running without interruption, nor quality degradation.
Maintain vendor relationship to ensure responsiveness and collaboration for troubleshooting.
Configure and maintain yearly training schedule and backend tasks to ensure smooth learning experience.
Make course assignments as needed.
Update content as needed.
Create and deploy annual performance and talent review process.

Identify root causes and provide updates and recommendations to leadership that will deliver a decrease in frequency and severity of system issues reported by end users. In addition, keeps up- to-date on system patches and new features and functionality.

3-5 years of experience configuring & maintaining with Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD)
Preferred
Experience performing PowerBI configuration and deployment.
Experience in a multi-regional healthcare, retail, or dental company.

Ability to multi-task effectively without compromising the quality of the work.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
Detail oriented, organized, process focused, problem solver, proactive, ambitious, customer service focused.
Ability to multitask and prioritize work in a high-volume environment, without compromising the quality of work / delivery.
Ability to respond to common inquiries from customers, staff, regulatory agencies, vendors, and other members of the business community.
Self-motivated, reliable individual capable of working independently as well as part of a team.

Overview:
It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year

Why UT Southwestern?

With over 75 years of excellence in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas, UT Southwestern is committed to excellence, innovation, teamwork, and compassion. At UT Southwestern, we invest in you with opportunities for career growth and development that align with your future goals and help to provide security for you and your family. Our highly competitive benefits package offers healthcare, PTO and paid holidays, on-site childcare, wage, merit increases and so much more that are all available on the day you start work. Job Summary

UT Southwestern Medical Center is hiring for Regulatory Analyst, Human Research Protection

The Regulatory Analyst will perform protocol pre-review prior to submission to the IRB. Provide consultation to PI on regulatory, scientific, or policy issues. Collaborate with IRB and other regulatory entities at the institution to provide optimal protocol review services for PIs. Directs, analyzes, coordinates, and evaluates research program operation and procedures. Develop, cultivate, and maintain working relationships with internal/external departments/agencies associated with and/or receiving benefit from the research program. Establish research program goals and objectives. Recommend new policies/procedures for improvement of program activities. Responsible for design, execution, and effectiveness of system of internal controls. Ensures compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures. Reads literature and attends training as necessary.

Experience and Education

Bachelor’s degree in related field and three (3) years related experience or a Master’s degree in related field and one (1) years of related experience is required.

Advanced science degree and extensive current knowledge of regulations governing human or animal research protections strongly preferred. Previous service on an IRB or IACUC a plus.

Job Duties

For campus-wide research, perform thorough protocol pre-review in advance of submission to the Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) and provide technical consultation to Principal Investigators on any regulatory, scientific, or policy issues that will affect the likelihood of IRB/IACUC approvals.

Collaborates closely with the IRB or IACUC and other regulatory entities at the institution to provide optimal protocol review services for investigators.

Directs, analyzes, coordinates, and evaluates research program operation and procedures.

Develops, cultivates, and maintains working relationships with internal/external departments/agencies and other organizations associated with and/or receiving benefit from the research program.

Establishes research program goals and objectives and directs clinical trials program evaluation and quality control activities; develops and/or approves schedules, priorities, and standards for achieving goals.

Recommends new policies and procedures for improvement of program activities.

Responsible for design, execution, and effectiveness of system of internal controls, which provide reasonable assurance that operations are effective and efficient.

Ensures compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies, and procedures.

Reads literature and attends training and other functions as necessary to keep abreast of relevant scientific, regulatory, and technical developments related to oversight of research.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Work requires excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills to work effectively with all levels of staff, faculty, and scientists.

Work requires ability to read, write, analyze data, develop plans and procedures, and coordinate resources to accomplish goals.

Work requires ability to provide technical assistance and consultation to physicians and other scientists.

Work requires responsibility for review, recommendation, development, and implementation of policies.

Work requires computer proficiency and comfort with electronic technology for data management.

Working Conditions

Work is performed primarily in general office area.

To learn more about the benefits UT Southwestern offers, visit https://www.utsouthwestern.edu/employees/hr-resources/

Job Description :
SENIOR HRIS ANALYST
JOB PURPOSE: The Sr. HRIS Analyst plays a vital role in enabling its customers to optimize the organization’s HRIS systems and create business value. Production support, reporting, data analysis, and configuring new Workday functionality are primary responsibilities. This individual works closely with team members and business partners to interpret data and develop solutions that provide value to our customers.
This position will require collaboration across the business to develop and implement data-driven solutions to ensure adherence to company compliance standards and maintaining internal audit process to ensure data integrity.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manages end to end employee data flow, deep understanding the payroll implication of the data entered. Integration support with 3rd party vendors.
Works collaboratively with HR partners and team members to troubleshoot, research, and escalate issues as necessary
Reviews system data on a regular basis to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness both within and across systems
Follow up with HR, Compensation, Benefits, Payroll and Department Managers to resolve data integrity issues
Escalate Data Processing issues to Management, along with recommendations for potential solutions
Must use discretion and independent judgment in data analysis and reviewing data integrity issues
Generate standard HRIS Reports as prescribed
Runs queries and reports to analyze data
Assist in the review, testing and implementation of system upgrades. Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. Work to research and resolve issues with data
Lead enhancement projects and change management. Gather, build and document business requirements from corporate supporting teams, liaise with IT on these requirements and test the resulting enhancements to ensure accurate functionality.
Develop and deliver training
Identify/Develop/Implement streamlined process
Provide alternate solutions and recommendations for complex business issues
Provide Tier II Support via internal ticketing tool.
Identify and prioritize key optimization opportunities
Maintain awareness on applicable Workday updates and trends, including evaluation and system testing for Workday releases.
Develop change management communications for Workday enhancements
Maintain up to date documentation for job aids, Opus materials, and business requirements
Manage documentation, including job aids, Opus materials, and business requirements related to the configuration of the core Workday system.
Execute mass data changes in core system (e.g. EIBs), ensuring highest level of data integrity and customer service orientation
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field of study or 4+ years of HRIS work experience
Recent Workday HRIS experience is required
Strong technical implementation skills
Ability to maintain confidentiality to sensitive employee information
Self-starter. Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
Team-oriented with the ability to build relationships and foster trust at all levels of the organization
Excellent collaboration and communications skills; including oral, written, interpersonal and presentation skills
Demonstrated experience translating business requirements into technical specifications
Exercises independent judgement and discretion in developing methods, techniques, and evaluation criterion for obtaining results
Ability to create dashboards, metrics, and advance analytical reports in Workday
Advanced MS Excel skills and Proficient in other MS Office Suite products
PREFERRED SKILLS:
3+ years of Workday HRIS experience
Workday Certification

Methodist Health System is a faith-based organization with a mission to improve and save lives through compassionate, quality healthcare. For nearly a century, Dallas-based Methodist Health System has been a trusted choice for health and wellness. Named one of the fastest-growing health systems in America by Modern Healthcare, Methodist has a network of 12 hospitals (through ownership and affiliation) with nationally recognized medical services, such as a Level I Trauma Center, multi-organ transplantation, Level III Neonatal Intensive Care, neurosurgery, robotic surgical programs, oncology, gastroenterology, and orthopedics, among others. Methodist has more than two dozen clinics located throughout the region, renowned teaching programs, innovative research, and a strong commitment to the community. Our reputation as an award-winning employer shows in the distinctions we’ve earned:
Magnet® designations for Methodist Dallas, Methodist Charlton, Methodist Mansfield, and Methodist Richardson Medical Centers
150 Top Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker’s Hospital Review, 2023
Top 10 Military Friendly® Employer, Gold Designation, 2023
Top 10 Military Spouse Friendly® Employer, 2023

Job Role: Configuration and Data Management Analyst

Location: Dallas, TX (Onsite)

Client: LTTS

Duration: Contract/Full Time

Job Description:

Description/Comment:

Job Summary:

The configuration manager establishes and maintains configuration processes; communicates these processes, variations, and deviations to the program; and coordinates, submits and maintains technical data and relevant processes.

Responsibilities:

Review program engineering configuration control methodology and variances in the Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) environment (ENOVIA) and provide specific direction to data owners that will prevent process or system issues and to ensure proper standards and quality are established and maintained
Monitor engineering release and provide appropriate and compliant data submittals to requesting or contracting customers.
Analyze program Functional, Allocated, Initial Product, and Product baselines in ENOVIA for compliance to industry and organization standards.
Analyze assigned program Feature/Configuration Item (CI) structure in ENOVIA and their related data and documentation elements
Analyze data to make recommendations that aid program and functional leadership to plan work, understand data flow, and reduce schedule impacts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and provide specific direction to data owners to ensure compliance.
Coordinate with contracts organization and customers regarding new or changing requirements.
Establish and maintain good working relationships with internal Bell and external customers (USG, regulatory agencies, partners, OEMs, and suppliers).
Schedule and manage activities related to program or product-related change boards (e.g. ****Technical Review Board (TRB), Configuration Change Board (CCB), etc.) by providing direction to participants and stakeholders before, during and after the sessions.
Support CM reviews and audits, including FCA/PCA and provide direction before, during and after the events to prevent or resolve issues.
Monitor the stability and health of the Engineering Bill-of-Material and Planning Bill-of-****Material for the assigned program and provide feedback to data owners regarding data issues.
Manage Contract Data Requirements List (CDRL) and Data Item Deliverable (DID) requirements.
Determine and apply the proper data marking to deliverable information.
Manage engineering data correction, consolidation, or system migration.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s or 4-year degree is required
Must have certification in configuration management
Configuration Analyst 3-8+ years of configuration management, data management, administrative or office environment experience
Familiarity with ENOVIA.
Familiarity with a Product Life-cycle Management (PLM) software, data management software, and document imaging software.
Practical and working knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), Export Administration Regulations (EAR) and associated markings.
Basic understanding of roles, tasks, policies and procedures required to execute the change process, configuration management, data management, and product-related data maintained in the ENOVIA environment.
Familiarity with the Configuration Management principles and methods contained in ANSI/EIA 649B, ISO 10007, and MIL-HDBK-61A.
Familiarity with the Data Management principles and methods contained in DI-SESS-81000E, DoD Directive 5230.24, and MIL-STD-31000A.
